review: Citalopram helped me so much during a hard season in my life. I was so hesitant in taking an antidepressant cause I knew I wasn’t depressed but I had a situation happen that caused my anxiety to sky rocket like never before . I had racing thoughts , pounding heart and couldn’t sleep . I took 20mg of citalopram for 5 years . All my racing thoughts were gone and no pounding heart and I could finally sleep !! Recently I have had a flare up again and went up to 30mg and have relief once again . Thank you Lord for making this medicine to help us out in hard times . Don’t be scared to try it . It does take along time to work but once it’s in your system you are so good . There is nothing wrong taking meds for mental health . They don’t change your personality and are non-addictive . There is one right one out there for everyone .

Celexa (citalopram):I started having really bad panic attacks a few weeks ago for absolutely no reason. It kept getting worse and worse, I wasn’t sleeping, and I ended up in the emergency room several times and I was given a prescription for was 10mg Celexa (citalopram) tablets and was instructed to take them at night before bed with a snack. That’s what I did, and roughly 40 minutes after I started panicking worse than ever before. I could barely stand, my vision was blurry and trailing, ears rang super loud. I shook like crazy. I only got an hour of sleep that night. The next night when I took it again, I didn’t have any panic but my head felt weird as anything. This has been my second day on it so far. My whole body feels numb, my head feels distant and I can’t remember anything, it’s hard to breathe, and my muscles ache and burn. My vision is currently messed up and I feel weird as anything. I don’t know how you all stuck through it but I’m stopping it. I can’t do it.

I'm 40 and started to have severe anxiety which was leading to depression.  I felt uncomfortable in my own skin and didn't want to leave my house.  I found it extremely difficult to work a full day and after work just wanted to lay in bed.  I ignored phone calls quite often as I just didn't feel good.  I started on 10mg of Celexa.  The first 1.5weeks were AWFUL.  I felt so restless and this tingly feeling in my teeth and overall weird / lightheaded feeling.  I had to take time off of work during this period.  I slowly increased my dose to 20mg over a 3 week period. Now I'm on week 5 and taking 20mg at night.  Now I'm back to my happy self.  My energy is back to normal.  More more social anxiety and wanting to avoid people.  I'm so happy I tried this medication.  Stick in there.  It's uphill after the first 2 weeks.

Celexa (citalopram):At the beginning of this year, I started experiencing severe depression and anxiety. I went on Celexa about 4, almost 5 weeks ago (20 mg). So far, I don't notice any improvement in my anxiety. I am concerned that the medication is adding to my anxiety, but am going to keep taking it because I heard it can take up to 6-8 weeks to kick in. Really hoping that will be my case. My symptoms lately have been anxiousness, chest tightness, loss of appetite, sweating/nervousness...and again I'm not sure if these symptoms have been influenced by the Celexa or not. I'm assuming the best thing to do is keep pushing through and I may be a case where it can take 2 whole months to kick in.

I love Celexa. I’ve had anxiety and panic attacks when I was young and xanax helped tremendously. But at 75 yrs I  started having spells with trying to speak without stammering. I thought I was having TIAs but my Dr thought it was stress. I haven’t had a single spell in a year since Celexa. And I’m not anxious in social situations. It’s been  wonderful for me.

Celexa (citalopram):I took Celexa for a few months about 4 years ago for a couple of months while experiencing extreme depression and anxiety. It seemed to help for a few weeks and then stopped. For a few weeks I had more motivation than usual and less depression and anxiety. It's the only anti-depressant I've taken that didn't cause extremely severe side effects.  I started again six months ago and it is doing absolutely nothing for my depression or anxiety, I just feel tired all the time and my depression and anxiety are getting worse every month. I've been having suicidal feelings for the last two months. The only side effect that has been consistent both times I've taken it is excessive sweating.... and I mean a ridiculous amount of sweating. If I exert myself at all I am dripping in sweat. Sometimes the night sweats are so bad I have to wash my sheets when I wake up because I'm soaked from head to toe.

I have been anxious since childhood. In my late 20s after having children I had severe panic attacks and was finally prescribed Prozac. Years later, I switched to Celexa because it has fewer side effects and felt like my problems were cured! I was on 40 MG for at least 10 years, and added Wellbutrin to counteract the sexual side effects. Went along happily for another 10 years but lowered my Celexa down to 20 MG a few years ago. I have noticed a few panic attacks slip in since then, but about 10 days ago I had a really bad attack and decided to go to my doctor. We increased my Celexa back up to 40 mg and he gave me a few 1mg Lorazepam for the really rough patches. However, I am basically unable to function right now. I can barely eat and the panic and anxiety are debilitating as soon as the Lorazepam wears off. I've been on the increased dose for 9 days now. Will it get better? I want my life back!!! I have a brand new granddaughter  and a great job and I just want to be me again.

Went on this for PTSD after a very difficult time. Made me very sleepy at first and weird runny issues like couldn’t go number 2 for ages. Have issues now with sexual dysfunction, I can’t orgasm no matter what. It seems to have played havoc with my skin and my metabolism too…like I was always very slim and now, despite being active and working out very regularly, I have slowly gained a lot of weight. I’m scared to go off it though as the fear of the come down is a worry.

This is the third time I’ve been on Citalopram since 2009. Each time I stayed on it for a few years. I’ve been suffering with anxiety for 24 years. Citalopram is fantastic at stopping panic attacks. I’m the kind of person who doesn’t like the idea of taking drugs and always come off it believing there are more natural ways to keep anxiety at bay. So when I started having panic attacks 24 years ago, like many people it was a living nightmare. I didn’t know what was happening to me and thought it was the end and would never recover. Anyway I always end up on it because of my bad lifestyle, drinking to much alcohol, eating crap and not exercising. When I do look after my self it does keep the anxiety at bay. Each time I go back on it I go through all the terrible side effects, which last a few weeks. I’d like to conclude, If you look after your self and take Citalopram, life can be great! I mostly take 20mg.

Celexa (citalopram):This has helped me with anxiety, depression, and OCD. The only regret I have is not taking it sooner. Absolutely life changing med. If you have side effects stick with it for a few weeks. I noticed my depression lessen within a week and three months in now I have zero anxiety or racing thoughts. OCD is all vanished. This should be your first line med for panic, anxiety, depression. I would never recommend benzodiazepines over this they end up exacerbating anxiety and are physically bad for you.

Celexa (citalopram):I suffered a massive left side hemorrhagic stroke 15 months ago.  While I have recovered almost completely from a physical perspective I was left with crippling anxiety.  I was in a constant state of fight or flight and often felt like I was going to pass out, I felt like it was a side-effect from the stroke that I was just going to have to accept and live with and I also felt bad complaining about it because I should be happy to still be alive.  I eventually mentioned it to my Doctor and she immediately made me feel better and told me we would work to fix it.  She started me on celexa 10mg x 10 days and then increased to 20mg daily.  The first couple of weeks were rough (jumpy, foggy) but after 2 weeks the side-effects subsided.  The 6-8 week mark was when I really noticed how much better I feel, almost no anxiety at all and I feel so much better.  I am so happy I was prescribed this medication.

I take citalopram because of my anxiety around sick. Feeling anxious being being sick was a constant before taking citalopram and now it barely crosses my mind and I never thought that I would get to that point. I feel back to my old self again and it’s such a freeing feeling as I am able to do anything now without having the constant anxiety. At first I was nervous to take it as one of the side effects is feeling/ being sick but I had no side effects what’s so ever and started to feel better within a week! I only take 10mg but that has fixed me! I honestly am so thankful for how it has made me feel and that I can return so enjoying life again.

Hello everyone...I have been taken citalopram 20 mg for over one year and it was perfect not until lately like two weeks it’s not working and my anxiety and depression has started coming..what should I do please help me out.

I got put on citalopram 3.5 years ago when my mum passed. I didn’t want to go on medication but it was affecting my life that I was scared to go out the door.  My husband said I was depressed & needed help, I  Eventually gave citalopram ago. I had a lot of side effects in the first few weeks, couldn’t sleep, going out in the garden even made me anxious. Eventually the tablets kicked in & I felt back to my normal self, so decided to drop from 20mg to 10mg. Was ok for 6 weeks & then the anxiety & depression kicked back in. The dr said if I wanted to go back on 20mg of which I have. I’m on 19 days. The last couple of days with COVID & family members getting it my anxiety is really bad, I’m feeling really tired all the time, I can’t switch off, if I think of something I get tingling my arms & legs. I can’t remember the first time I took it how long it took b4 I felt my self. But it worked wanders. I’m hoping it want be long b4 I feel good again.

Gave me massive tinnitus and turned me into a zombie, I lasted 10 days on 10mg then had to stop as I was a mess. It’s a mild antihistamine so if you’re sensitive to sedating medicines this might not be for you.

I've been on citalopram for more the 12 years I had dropped to a 10mg after having my child but now due to anxiety my doctor put me up to a 20mg and I'm nearly 2 weeks in to taken them and my anxiety is through the roof. My mornings are the worst and I'm finding it hard to see the light at the end of the tunnel as its so intense. I've never had side affects from upping my medication and I think citalopram is brilliant just unfortunately this time around the side effects have scared me. Dose anyone have any inspiration for me please

Ok, I promised myself I would write on here once I started to feel myself again. I’m in week 7 and they have only JUST started to kick in. I had many manyyyyy days thinking when will I ever get better, is this really as good as it gets? Do I need to change meds? Shall I up my dose? When are the negative intrusive thoughts about death going to end! It was such a difficult time and the tablets increased my anxiety, black intrusives, for 7 weeks straight. I was so close to giving up but I thought I may as well continue I’ve come this far. A lot of stuff I have read says 2 months until effectiveness. Please trust me when I say this, give it two months. No less. They take so long to start doing their job do not give up, because once they do, you will feel back in the real world again. Im still on a journey for sure, I still get a bit disconnected sometimes and anxious, but I feel something great now. BE patient. Oh and the side effects are horrific but so worth it!! I feel me.

Celexa (citalopram):I started taking Celexa 20mg 15 years ago and now I’m taking 40mg. I take mine at night. It still help me so I will not go off of Celexa ever! I don’t feel like I don’t ever want to be around people and my depression is so much better!!

Excellent medication. The first 3 weeks for me were very difficult as I had a lot of the side effects, almost all of the side effects have gone now and life has almost returned to normal. A lifesaver. Please be patient for the first few weeks as the tablets make things worse initially, just wait for the improvements to start showing and you'll be glad you persevered. Taking Promethazine twice a day and doing an online CBT course really helped initially to keep me calm. I take 20mg of citalopram at night, took 10mg for the first week.

I started taking citalopram when I was 15 or 16 years old for depression. I'm 32 now so I can't really remember what it was like at first. I don't recall any serious side effects but it's been a fat minute. Anyways my (now ex) Dr. Suddenly stopped refilling it one day a few months ago. Stopped cold turkey out of nowhere for no explanation. After a few weeks my life spiralled out of control. It's been a nightmare. Pain, weakness, fatigue horrible outrageous mood swings, thoughts of suicide and self harm. A literal nightmare. This med works but do not just stop taking it. And if your Doctor just takes you off it cold turkey without any reason as to why... Get a second opinion or ask questions. I have a new Doctor and she has started me back on Citalopram and seemed pretty annoyed that my last doctor did that to me.

I was on Citalopram for 5 years, started off on 10mg and went to 20mg and 30mg.  10mg actually worked fine, however I met it halfway and stayed on 20mg before weaning off and remaining ok until an emotional episode triggered the intense anxiety, and now I'm back on 20mg, I'm a 50 year old man.  I think the way my life has gone I will always succumb to reaching out for these meds if something emotional is hits my life, however I suppose though that isn't a bad thing. As they literally salvage your sanity and keep you on track, the anxiety this time around kept me awake for 4 days!!  On both occasions they have worked instantly from the first administration, I'm only on day 2 regarding this second experience, and although not fully back to where I was I can notice a large improvement.. Dreading the libido aspects, but you never know it may not happen this time and I can't say that it was dire the first time that I took these drugs..

I am here because I was obsessed with reading these reviews when I was first put on Cipramil.I have GAD, but very controlled. Can only remember a handful of times in my life when my anxiety crippled me. Tried Zoloft and Lexapro once, couldn't continue because I experienced suicidal thoughts, out of the blue.Fast forward to 4 months ago, several incidents woke me up in a panic one day and my heart rate was consistory 120+. Friends on Cipramil begged me to try it.The side effects were a nightmare at first. Nausea, diarrhoea, heart palpitations, extreme panic, sobbing uncontrollably, convulsions.10 days in, it eased, I could function. Each day got better, 3 months felt back to normal, better than normal. In love with life. Don't forget to meditate, even if it seems like it's not doing anything at first.The only lingering effect is night sweats. Bothered me at first but now I don't even wake up from it.You will get better. You won't always feel this way.

I’ve been on citalopram for 4 years. I love it because it makes it that I can function normally. No side affects that I’ve noticed. I tried to go off it last year thinking I could handle my anxiety in my own. After realizing I feel more like myself on this drug I went back to it and have felt normal ever since.

I was given this for primarily anxiety but also was told it would help with PMDD symptoms as well. Been on it for 2 weeks and this medication has made such a difference in my quality of life already. The only side effects I had were during the first week and those were feeling chest pressure and jitters when I first woke up. Within 30-45 minutes they were gone. That only happened a few days and now I don’t notice anything. I had one day I would consider ‘bad’, very irritable, wanting to cry from being overwhelmed and jitters but after an hour it went away. It didn’t linger at all like it had been. I’m on 20 mg and I started out at this dose too. So far it seems to be just what I needed. I’m now looking forward to the next day instead of going to bed with dread about what was going to bother me. It may not work for everyone but it has me and I’m very thankful.

Celexa (citalopram):I have been on Celexa for 3 weeks now and I can already feel a huge difference. I was having panic attacks while at work to where I would need to walk away and go into a bathroom to calm down. I would have melt downs at home getting home from work and having to deal with my two boys (3 yrs old & 10yrs old) who were not listening and coming home to a messy house after working all day. Now I come home and I am more at ease, calm and not having any attacks. The first week an a half were a little rough with the side effects tiredness, nauseous, headaches, increased panic attacks, hot flash symptoms (sweating a lot) hungry (I am talking every 10 minutes not feeling full hungry)  and now on week 3 all of my symptoms have gone away. I am taking 10mg Celexa and I see my primary 11/30 for a follow up so hopefully by week 4-6 my anxiety will be gone as well.

Hi ya so I started citalopram 20mg 9 days ago and I'm not feeling myself at all. I take mine in the morning as I did try nights but it caused  insomnia.Every morning I wake up take the 20mg but then I feel really spaced out, dizzy, sick, heart racing, no energy at all, feel detached from my own body, I get prickling in my arms and legs.  I'm also taken lorazepam  to try keep me calm throughout  the day.  My GP told me the first 2 weeks are the worst so I'm really hoping by Monday things start changing. Anyone else just started and feeling like this? I'm so scared these feelings won't go away.Thank you, Jadie

Hi,  I was just posting as over the last week I’ve spent hours on this Forum and a lot of the posts have helped. I first went on Citalopram to deal with racing thoughts and low level anxiety that is probably work / stress related.  After three days of taking 10 mg the effects were horrendous.  My anxiety went through the roof and I started to have panic attacks, my mind was going at a million miles per hour.  I couldn’t sleep ( though the doctor gave me sleeping pills after I called them back after two days, which took the edge off). I thought taking the tablet was the stupidest mistake I’d ever made.Fortunately this started to calm down around day 5. I’m now on day 8 and the panic attacks have stopped.  The anxiety is now noticeably less than before I took the first tablet and given they take a fewweeks to work properly,  I’m quite looking forward the the results over the next few days.

Celexa (citalopram):I am a 28 year old female (born female). My anxiety, night terrors, nightmares, the feeling in my chest of needles, the crying, the repetitive negative thoughts, the aggression, the sudden onset of anger, I was an absolute functional terror. Everything to me was so intense, all of my feelings; the intensity I could not handle. First dose and I felt better, just 10mg. I felt a wave of just "ahhh" wash over me within an hour of the first dose. I felt free. Side effects? I went from sleeping 4-5 hours a night to a full 8. Appetite improved and is more balanced. I take mine in the morning every day prior to work and it has helped me be better at my job, which is taking care of disabled people. The job ate me up with stress and now I don't dread going every day - I can clearly understand that this is my role and I am important. I'm not so grouchy or quick to anger anymore. I suffered from anxiety since childhood and parents weren't keen on medicine. I would be lost without this medication.

Hi everyone, I’m new to this forum. Just want any reassurance please, I was on Citalopram for 5 years for anxiety/depression, it stopped working so doctor put me on Sertraline back in May, felt better to begin with but rapidly went downhill. I’m now back on Citalopram which I started on 22nd September 20mg. Increased to 30mg after 2 weeks but the anxiety is exhausting. I’m hoping that because I had the short break from Citalopram, that it will work for me again. I haven’t been on it a month yet so should I give it more time. I’m struggling to sleep also.

Started taking citalopram (celexa 20mg) Sept 10th, it will be 6 days til I've been taking this medication for 5 weeks. The heart palpitations/fluttering in my chest I was having for two weeks before I started this medication have returned as of Oct 2nd. They are so disturbing and frightening and make me so exhausted. I felt great the couple weeks on the medication but I did have nights where I'd wake up wide awake in the middle of the night with my heart racing and in a deep panic, which has happened a few times. I smoke marijuana to keep my calm but sometimes it does the complete opposite. I'm thinking that drinking plays a huge part in any side effects worsening as I do drink a little heavier on weekends than I do on weekdays. Usually would have 2-3 bottles of beer a night but since I've started this medication there has been a lot of family events that I've had to attend and alcohol ends up being consumed.

My doctor started me on Citalopram two months ago.  I only take 10mg as I am not used to taking these types of medications. I had tried every natural way to deal with this prior such as St Johns Worth and stress and anxiety pills (natural).  First the doctor prescribe me duloxetine which gave me the most horrible side effects so I didn't keep taking it.  Citalopram gave me some side effects at first, but not nearly as bad. I did have some shaking, vomiting, a fast heart rate and insomnia at first.  I tried to drink coffee the morning after taking it (I drink coffee every morning) and had a horrible reaction.  I stuck with it and just reminded myself to breathe.  After about a week my symptoms cleared up.  I feel much better now and I am also able to sleep much better now that I take Citalopram.  I highly recommend that you stick with it because if you think these side effects are bad you won't be able to handle any other medication.  The side effects for this are mild.

I’ve been on citalopram 10mg for around 10 days now. I will be honest, the first 5 days were absolutely brutal. Nausea, lack of appetite, panic attacks, and insomnia. But I’m so glad I stuck through it. I’m on day 10 and I feel like my normal self again. I started out taking it at night because it was said to cause drowsiness. But after a week of no sleep, I decided to switch to taking it in the mornings and I finally started sleeping through the night.

Celexa (citalopram):Had an issue with night time anxiety that interfered substantially with sleep. After about one week on Celexa, the issue (which I had grappled with for a couple of years) entirely vanished. I feel great, well rested, and more energetic.  Co-pay was high, but you can easily find an online coupon to keep the co-pay at $10.

I’m 19 and started taking this medication 10 weeks ago now. I started off on 10mg and the first few days were horrible, I felt heavy headed and dizzy, everything seemed slow, I would wake up through the night a few times and find it hard to fall back asleep, I had horrible, weird, reoccurring dreams. I had a high heart rate and my hands were constantly shaking, my mouth was dry and I had no energy through the day. In just over a week I felt these side effects calm down a bit, and then after another week I felt like nothing was happening and then I got put on 20mg. Some of those side effects came back, I also started urinating really frequently and woke up one day with over 20 bruises on my legs which I really scared me. It’s been 10 weeks now and no side effects, I’m the happiest I’ve ever been, no panic attacks which previously took over my life, no negative thoughts, no worries, my life is finally amazing. Please be patient

So it’s been a week today that I am on half a pill of 20 mg Citalopram and the side effects are horrible (headache, chills, weird burning sensation throughout my body, I’m so much more tired than usual, loss of appetite), but I am trying to hang in there. I haven’t had a panic attack or anxiety attack since so I do have hope. Hopefully the side effects won’t last much longer.

Took 1 dose 10mg.  2 hours until effects noticed. Felt like a wave of fog. No concentration, trembling,  anxiety, dry mouth, tired, nausea, lack of interest and energy, wanted to function but felt like being mentally restrained. This is a horrible drug in my opinion. Never ever again. 12hours later effects lessened but still notable.  By 21 hours effects gone thankfully.

Celexa (citalopram):Incredible. My anxiety is nearly nonexistent after being overwhelming for almost two decades to the point of self harm to cope. No more rumination and I barely remember what it felt like even though I used to think about the same thing for weeks and months at a time, all day and all night, every waking moment...even interrupting attempts at conversation or TV or books. I feel normal and I'd forgotten what that was like. I am amazed. So thankful. No more constant pit of dread in my stomach, no more nausea. Only temporary side effect was dry mouth. It did make my existing diarrhea worse and that has lasted but it is a small price to pay, I don't mind at all.
Celexa (citalopram):I've been on Celexa for about 10 years and it has really helped with my panic attacks.  I did gain some weight but it's worth the comfort that the pill gives me.

This has been my go to depression medication since I was 17. I am now 35. I never stay on it long. Sometimes only a month and I always only take the lowest dose. Lowest dose pill and cut it in half. This medication is STRONG. Best to go lowest dose. It has always been a miracle medication for me and I am so thankful to have it when I need it.

I suffered from Anxiety after a surgical procedure I had right when Covid started. I felt like I was having complications from surgery but I was not. I would run to the hospital, even called an ambulance once and everything was normal. Nothing was wrong with me. I started having severe nausea, lost sleep, crying all the time, no appetite. I felt like I was going to have a heart attack. I went to the doctor and was prescribed Citalopram 10 mg. The side effect were bad but I was already feeling really sick. I still had trouble sleeping, I would sweat all night and felt electric shocks in my legs. The medication started working after about 2 weeks. Then after being ok for about 3 weeks I started feeling sick again so my doctor increased my meds to 20 mg and again it took about 1 week to start working. I have been able to live a normal life thanks to Citalopram.   I have been normal for over 1 year and overall my mood is better and I am a calmer person. Hang in there it will get better.
Celexa (citalopram):I been on Celexa for 2 years I feel tired all day with no energy. The only drugs that work are the doctor's can't write because, they are controlled substances.

Back in 2012 I went through an extremely rough patch. I was in the hospital multiple times to figure out the source of what I was feeling, and at the time I drank heavily, smoked weed practically all day every day, and indulged in other drugs. Doctors kept sending me home saying it was just the drugs. I afterwards quit everything and still had the same feelings, thoughts, and sporadic attacks. I went back to the hospital one more time and made it clear that I was and had been sober for a while now, and after a long gruelling process was diagnosed with Generalized Anxiety Disorder, PTSD, severe depression, and Panic Disorder. I was given Celexa, and for me it was basically a last hope. I had so much wrong with me, nothing to my name, no friends since I quit drinking and doing drugs, I was one wrong turn from ending it. Fast forward the story to present time, and I'm still on Celexa. I'm engaged, have a house, and a beautiful daughter. OH and I'm still sober. Always keep fighting.

Celexa (citalopram):I started taking this medication at 10 mg at the end of May. It’s now mid August and I will admit it took awhile to work. The first couple of days, my side effects were enhanced anxiety, could not sleep, early awakening, fast heart beat and headache, but it all went away after the first week. Before taking citalopram, I would have break downs out of nowhere, intrusive thoughts, and panic attacks. I tried everything before trying medication because I was definitely hesitant, but I’m really glad I tried it. It’s now been over two months and I feel a lot better. I don’t worry about having to leave a situation because of a break down anymore and I get less panic and can brush off intrusive thoughts. Obviously there’s no magic pill, so I still get anxiety and I still have bad days (especially around the time of my period), but citalopram has helped a lot and my family and friends have noticed. It’s really nice not to be crying all the time lol

I have been suffering with severe anxiety and panic attacks since the start of this year. I have just started citalopram 10mg. I am on my 7th day of taking it and since I have taken it I have felt so numb but also have chest pain and burning In the middle of my chest and on the left side. I am still very frightened of what to do, I have never taken medication for anything except antibiotics..

Celexa (citalopram):I’ve been on Celexa for a little over a year now, and I feel like the meds and I are in a really good groove at this point. Celexa has given me my life back. I struggle with crippling anxiety and panic attacks. I am now able to work, travel and exist without the misery of anxiety. I have absolutely no regrets giving Celexa a go and have no plans to discontinue it any time soon.

Hi,I have been on Citalopram twice.The first time all went well and my anxiety levels and depression were kept under control, life was great.I was weaned off after two years and things seemed fine, had some initial side effects coming off.About two years ago I had to go back on Citalopram as I was going through a tough time. I was on 20mg. I developed unexplained joint, muscle and tendon pain. I had jaw pain suffered with pins and needles and numbness in my hands. This was more prevalent during the night which disturbed my sleep. I was sent to physios, chiropractors, rheumatologists, and acupuncture sessions to try and resolved this unexplained pain which was getting progressively worse. Nothing helped!I decided to wean off the Citalopram to see if this would make any difference. Eureka after 6 weeks of being off the Citalopram my pain has gone. Citalopram was great for the anxiety and depression, but beware, chronic pain side effects

Yesterday was my first day taking citalopram and it was 10mg. it made me feel really weird and crazy. I was sweaty but cold. I could hardly open my eyes, my pupils were huge. It’s now the next morning and i still feel slightly weird but I'm definitely not taking citalopram anymore.

Took this for 1 day and felt like I was poisoned.  10mg made me feel SO horribly it was scary.  Nauseous beyond words to the point I was almost going to go the the ER.  It felt like someone was standing on my chest too and I felt more out of sorts than I normally have lately which was not good either.  The physical effects were miserable for me at least.  Felt like I had drunk way too much caffeine or something.  Done after day 1, there was no way I was continuing that stuff.

I was on this medicine for about six years for depression and anxiety. It helped me regulate my emotions. I had dry mouth, light sensitivity, and dizziness at first. During the last year of taking this medicine  started having intense episodes of hot flashes. It felt like my entire body was burning from the inside out, during these episodes my blood pressure would go up sky high and my heart would pound, after the burning went away my body would shake like I had cold chills. They came once in awhile and then more often as time went on. I  thought I was gonna die with these episodes, but after I stopped the medicine I have not had one since.

Celexa (citalopram):My 77 year old mother who had a history of high blood pressure and was undergoing treatment for a UTI with the antibiotic Macrobid took a Selexa on a Tuesday and had a stroke on the next Wednesday. She broke out in red itchy hives starting on her legs and going to her stomach, chest, neck and face. She was confused, couldn’t write or operate her telephone properly and very lethargic. This drug needs more testing with the elderly I think. She is now in the hospital recovering.

This was the first antidepressant medication I tried, so I didn’t know what to expect and was worried it would change my personality or make me lose impulse control. My GP started me on a dose lower than the adult starting dose and told me my anxiety might get worse for a week or two but to push through it and then it should work and the side effects should go away. I never experienced any side effects, or any main effects. At each review appointment (every month or six weeks) I reported that nothing had changed and the dose was increased. There was never any effects, even at the highest possible dose. After half a year on this medication with nowhere further to go with it (no more dosage increases), we started decreasing the dose slowly so I could come off it and try something else. I never noticed any effects of coming off it either. Nothing happened at all, I was left feeling like I’d lost half a year of potential treatment.

I started feeling better, less anxious and calmer very quickly. Some slight nausea and dry mouth soon went. However after about a month I started getting a very loud heartbeat which increased and now sounds very loud in my left ear. My right ear is also ringing. I read that tinnitus is a side effect and sometimes permanent so am going to speak to dr about coming off. It's made my insomnia worse. I am on 10mg.

POSITIVE REVIEW - As a person with severe anxiety who is terrified of any medication and have been avoiding meds for years due to fear of side effects, I couldn't be more thankful for giving it a go. I'm the type of person that googled symptoms even if I have a random involuntary twitch, and then come to a conclusion that I have 2 weeks to live lol. I was mortified of taking these. But anxiety become unbearable and the brain fog with it, I felt very stupid at times, with no focus or ability to think or remember things. I have these for a week I felt quite monotone, with not much emotion. That's about it! I haven't had brain fog since taking these, no panic attacks, my thoughts aren't racing anymore like they used to. I can see a massive difference! I'm much happier! With no side effects what so ever. Life is good. Please give them a try because everyone is different :) Even if you do feel unwell, please try for a couple months as it may be a life changing decision. Good luck!

Celexa (citalopram):I’ve been taking 20mg Celexa (generic version) for 27 days now and in the last week have started feeling the positive effects.  Thank goodness because oh lordy, did I ever have EVERY side effect for the first 2-2.5 weeks!  Deep tiredness, nausea, diarrhea, brain fog/spacey-ness, those were the most prominent ones.  I really wanted to quit but kept going, and I’m glad I did.  Finally over the last couple days the bad side effects have subsided considerably and I can feel the positives:  happiness, lightness, no more sinking feelings, renewed interest, patience, and a more relaxed mind.  I am smiling at people.  If you’re having all the side effects, hang in there!  Stick it out, take Imodium and/or Zofran, eat crackers and ginger ale, etc with the hope that it may be totally worth it.  Hang on for that breakthrough.  I’m a newly minted Celexa believer!

Started on 10mg of citalopram. Now have been put on 20mg for about 2 weeks. Some of the side effects seem to have reoccurred.  Does it take a while for these to settle again.  It’s like taking it for the first time.  Any advice would be helpful.

I wanted to wait until this medication kicked in before I posted. For extreme anxiety and depression. My anxiety and phobia of going out was so bad. I couldn't go outside, I couldn't work or focus on my children. I was missing out on the joys of life. My depression was also very bad . After 8 weeks on Citalopram it finally kicked in full force at 40mgs, All my anxiety went away,  depression has lifted . This medication makes you not sweat the little things. I believe I will never quit this medication. I had most of the side effects. Extreme anxiety, nervousness, tremors, sweats, confusion, body aches, dry mouth, head aches.  It took 8 weeks. Even by 7 weeks I was not well. If you have started this medication it can be very hard at first for weeks with the increased anxiety and side effect.  It does go away , it does work. You have to give it time. It is a life saver and life is too short to be depressed and anxious. Don't let life pass you by when there is treatment.

I started citalopram at the lowest point in my life mentally. Since starting, my anxiety is completely gone, I don’t overthink every intricate detail of my life for hours. As a consequence I have got my life back together, stopping steroids, getting a new job, being able to study better at uni, getting back into amateur boxing and meeting my current girlfriend. None of this would have been achievable without Citalopram. It has helped me  in many ways and this is just the start. Other positive side effects where feeling calmer, having a constant stable mood. Essentially it has allowed me to live my life without wanting to end it every time I wake up.

Been on 40mg each day for a few years now, days just got too much to bear over thinking  things etc , but citalopram  helped  a lot was able to get a job which I was able to hold down and also met my wife. There is light at the end of the tunnel  , you've just got to stick with it goodluck.

Amazing......  I have been on citalopram 20mg for about 6 months.  I was very skeptical to be honest.  I don't like to take drugs of any sort. I get what some people call medicine head.  But I tried it.  I started at 10 mg for 2 weeks then went to 20 mg.  The side effects were rough at first as my body got used to it.  Just hang in there the burning feeling (like hot flashes) and tiredness will get better.  For a few month before I sought treatment I was not able to leave the house and had bad panic attack for no reason .  Believe me it gets better and soon you'll get your life back. I did and owe it to citalopram !!!!!!!

Have always had minor anxiety. Had major surgery in 2020 and was off work for approx 8 weeks. I'm a train driver and do shift work on a 24 hour rotating roster. Started back at work and starting going into fight or flight sometimes up to 9 hours. After a couple of months of struggling my GP put me on Mirtazapine. 6 months on that and no change. Got a new GP and she started me on Lexam. I'm into week 5.. There's been some improvement but not a great deal. And the headaches!! Wow!! I'm hoping by week 6 the headaches improve. Has anyone else experienced this? And found the anxiety and headaches eventually go away?
Celexa (citalopram):I’ve been taking celexa 10mg for 3 weeks at night I been real nauseous with no appetite did this happen to anyone else ? And will it get any better.

Horrendous drug. I had a spell of bad anxiety and went to the GP who prescribed Citalopram. I thought it was helping but ended up in a cycle of normality and bad anxiety for years. Finally, after a few years, I realised the drug was making it worse. I stopped taking it and followed the Linden Method, which eventually got me back to normal. Constant, inappropriate anxiety is just the brain being stuck on heightened alert, which can happen for many reasons. You don't need medication to make it go away. This drug was a nightmare for me and thank god I saw the back of it many years ago.

At first I was skeptical, I was really scared to start taking it and thought it might change who I am or alter my personality, make me drowsy or gain a ton of weight. When I started taking it my anxiety went up a bit, probably because I was taking a new med and already in a really bad place. I’ve been patient and I’m now 3 and a half weeks in and I honestly feel great. I feel much less day to day, constant anxiety and I feel so much happier throughout the day. My mood has stabilized and I feel far less worried and and upset by the people, things and situations around me. I have more energy and I just feel more at ease if that makes sense. I honestly haven’t noticed any side effects either. I’m really happy I took the leap and started taking citalopram. I didn’t really realize how bad things were until I realized how much better I’m feeling now. I feel like I’m getting my life back and I’m starting to feel like myself again.

This medication was an absolute life changer for me. I was unable to go many places and struggled to get through work some days. I read every review over and over and obsessed about whether or not to begin this medicine. I’m so grateful that I listened to the positive reviews and gave it a chance. It didn’t take long at all before I was able to do things I had not done in years! I highly recommend giving it a chance .

I have recently been in and out of hospital 4 times not knowing what was wrong with me. All physical tests normal, I've been suffering panic attacks and anxiety. Brought on by combination of events my dad and dog passing away and covid. I left hospital Monday and was started on 10mg citralapram,  and 8mg x 3 a day betahistine for dizziness.  I'm on day 4 and it's been really hard . Anxiety still through the roof, cannot function,  sweating,  headaches, nausea , eyes not focusing.  I've been told to stick at it as it gets easier . At the moment it's the hardest thing I've ever done in my life. Just hoping there is some improvement soon

I tried 10mg and it made me hungry like crazy!  I gained about 8lbs fast.  I dropped the dosage down to 5mg and there is no more increased appetite and I was able to lose the weightThis is the only medication I have ever found that reduces my anxiety!!! So grateful for it

I’ve never realized that I’ve been struggling with anxiety all my life. Always thought that this was my personality to be snappy and reactive, and feeling my heart pound out of my chest was a norm. Fast forward few years I had a baby. My anxiety skyrocketed to the point I was not able to sleep. The baby slept through the night yet I couldn’t even though I was exhausted. Dr suggested citalopram. The first 1 week was hard. I experienced every side effect imaginable, however it started to ease up by the second week. I am now 4 weeks in. Although my sleep is still messed up, I have never felt this OK with life. I find myself in situations where I usually would be very frazzled feeling so at peace now. It’s like someone put a stop on the flight or fight mode. I’m writing this as I have spent weeks reading other ppl reviews, being petrified of taking an antidepressants. So far so good, I feel like some part of my old self is back. Stick it out, it does get better.

Anxiety came out of the blue for me.  At the beginning I was anxious but could cope with it. That soon changed it manifested everyday until I was taking panic attacks, couldn’t sleep or eat. My gp prescribed me sertraline 25mg . Which was the worst! Made everything 500% worse.(terrible drug) I took them for 3 days then stopped, my GP then prescribed me citalopram 10mg felt slightly better the first week still feeling anxious but not as bad, managed to sleep but (woke up early.)  and eat. I didn’t have many side effects yawing a lot felt tired first week. Some stomach trouble but nothing major. I’m now on day 12 some days are better than others. Remain anxious in the mornings. Some days it lasts an hour then leaves and I feel relatively normal other days it lasts the whole day. I’m hopeful that this medication will improve my symptoms in a few weeks. I take my medication in the morning. I’m hoping to feel normal soon. Hang in there guys.

Celexa (citalopram):Hey Everyone,Thank you for sharing your testimonies. I am 45 years old. I had my first experience with anxiety and panic at 37. I was hospitalized because I didn't know what was going on with me. I kept running to emergency room but my physical being would check out ok. That's when I was admitted to Psych and discovered I had Anxiety and Depression. Hardest thing I ever went through in life. Well recently I just went through it again. Racing thoughts, sleepless night, hopelessness,  feelings of doom. I started back on celexa 20mgs and was worried it wasn't working. I came here read comments and found hope to stick it out and as the weeks passed felt better and better.. at 3 weeks I felt better. 4 weeks little of no racing thoughts or worry. 5 weeks completely in better mood. 6 weeks felt normal again. I still have some worry but not nearly as bad. Hang in there

Tried citalopram 10mg daily. First ever antidepressant. Took it after breakfast, had lots of activating symptoms on the first day. Second day, severe nausea, couldn’t eat anything, only settled in the evening. Weird tingling sensations, felt very charged up. Stopped shortly after because of the bad nausea

Started taking citalopram after experiencing chronic anxiety for months. The first time I was on it for a year and the doctor tapered me off and I had no side effects and no anxiety for about 7 years. In 2018 stress caused anxiety so I decided to go to my doctor to be put back on. Doc prescribed me citalopram 20mg which kicked in a few weeks after my first dose. I felt normal again. After almost 2 years I decided I was well and thought I could come off them again like I did the first time. Boy was I wrong. This time around symptoms started kicking in a few weeks after my last pill. I experienced horrible symptoms. Nausea, crying, nervousness, panic, no appetite, gagging, dry heaving, fatigue, intrusive thoughts. After 3 weeks I went back to my doctor to be put back on the meds. It’s been 6 weeks and I’m feel better. I’m able to eat now, less gagging, less intrusive thoughts. I feel the medication is slowing starting to work. I definitely feel a lot better than I did a month ago.

I always said that I would write a post on here if I ever got over my mental breakdown, so here goes...I had a miscarriage and this triggered my first ever panic attack in 2017. I felt like I was dying and the world was fading around me. After this attack I couldn't relax, fearing that it will happen again. I became totally obsessed with monitoring myself and trying to remain calm (which meant I was constantly anxious 24/7). The person I used to be was completely gone for almost a year.I broke down at the docs and was prescribed 20mg citalopram. First week side effects were electric feelings in my body. No improvement till week 7 when I suddenly felt free from my mind for 20 secs. I'd get more of these little snapshots of normality where I could remember how it feels to be safe in my own skin. By 6 months on I was fully recovered and remain that way 2 years on.You can get 100% better. When you overcome fear anything is possible.

I tapered off citalopram completely about four weeks ago after taking it for two years. I noticed my anxiety was getting worse so I bit the bullet and started taking my 20 MG tablets again four days ago. It’s been a living nightmare since I started taking the med again. Extreme anxiety (worst I’ve ever had), panic attacks, night sweats, paranoia, nausea, etc. etc. I could use a little encouragement. Maybe somebody has had a similar experience to mine and would be willing to share. I’m going to stick it out but this is been very hard.

Had a bag anxiety attack about a month ago.   Attack would not leave me after a week so saw the doctor and was prescribed citalopram 20mg - I was to take 1/2 (10mg) the first 7 days then go up to 20mg.    The side effects were really hard.   I was jittery, very anxious, nauseous, foggy head. Mind you I knew all these were side effects and not me alone - so I tried to remember that I was not going totally crazy.  By the end of the first week there was no way I was going up to 20 mg per day.   I saw my doctor on day 9 to talk about staying at 10mg.   But, by day 8 the bad side effects subsided somewhat and I felt a little better.   The doctor agreed it was ok for me to stay at 10 mg per day.   It has been two weeks now and I am feeling a lot better.   For those of you going through the very bad side effects, try to stick it out.   You will feel better.    But if after two weeks they are still bad - talk to your doctor about possibly another type of drug.   Hope you feel better soon.

Celexa (citalopram):I took Celexa for three months. Side effects included headaches, horrible period pain, sexual disfunction and horrible heartburn, to name a few. For me I knew the medication wasn’t working after about 3 months after I upped my dose to 20 mg. I just wasn’t getting better; I also had really bad mood swings and since my anxiety wasn’t improving I was taking a lot of my emergency medication (Xanax.) I switched to Zoloft and love it... good luck to everyone trying to find what works for them! Hang in there.

I started on Citalopram January 2017 after having panic attacks, anxiety and delayed grief. I was scared of the side effects so only took half of a 20mg pill. I didn't notice any side effects really but felt so much better, about 5 weeks later I felt almost normal. I stayed on 10mg for 2 years never increasing it and decided I would try to wean off it. I was only off the drug for at most 6 weeks when my anxiety and panic came back really bad. I was also very emotional and felt like I had attachment anxiety. Back on Citalopram 20mg for a few weeks then down to 10mg for 2 and half years. Tried to come off again and low and behold panic and anxiety after about 6 weeks off. This is now and I've been back on 10mg for 4 weeks and I'm still getting anxious but no panic as yet.Think I might need a higher dose. Only long term effects are sometimes I don't feel much, hard to get that excited about anything and it effects my libido but its better than the god awful panic.

It took just over 5 weeks for 20mg dose to work to calm my anxiety. During those weeks I was in a terrible state so frightened and unable to sleep I  really thought I was losing my mind. So many times I thought of stopping but decided I would give it 6 weeks and I'm glad I did. The strange thing is at 3 weeks I had 2 or 3 good days and thought I was making good progress but then I went backwards. I decided to score each day out of 10 and hovered around 2 for a long time but I gradually started to improve and the score increased. I'm writing this to give hope to anyone struggling in the early weeks. I now feel like the old me, my mood is good, I don't dwell on negative thoughts and I sleep much better.

First time writing something like this I have struggled with anxiety and racing thoughts mixed with depression for a long time to the point where I couldn’t even leave my own house scared of my own thoughts. I refused to take antidepressants for so long thinking I could handle it but sometimes it’s a bit too much as you need balance in your own mind.  So it’s now the 2nd day on citalopram 10mg I have noticed I have been yawning a lot, don’t feel nausea as of yet anxiety hasn’t changed a little more tired than usual but that’s probably due to the stress but it’s only early days. I will keep you guys posted for the people who want to take it. Trust me when I say this I get scared each time I take a tablet but I tell myself that I want my life back and I don’t want to struggle so much anymore. If this tablet can help me in some way then let’s do it you’ve got this!

Celexa (citalopram):Celexa is best it could have been great if not for weight gain, erectile dysfunction. Before Celexa I was smart and my erection was like iron rod. Apart from that it makes you sometimes too much blind to the issues like I had left two jobs great jobs. It tricks you into comfortable zone you lose touch with some important issues. So it works perfectly well health wise but it can affect your career. This is my personal experience. For many it can boost their career.

I’m on day 6. I’m experiencing really uneasy feeling in head, nausea, worse anxiety. Hoping this goes away as I’m at my wits end! Has anyone else experienced like I say this weird uncomfortable feeling in there head/ eyes

First three days horrible feeling anxiety more than 100% hot flashes, out of space feeling which was bad.  Then next days becoming better. Eighth day was ok during the day but night not at all very anxious couldn’t sleep . Now I’m on day 16th I truly believe this medication will help as I experienced more better days than bad . So whoever is just about to start this medication, please do not be afraid of side effects at the beginning it is manageable;-) just think positive

Last summer I was hit suddenly with anxiety attacks which lead to the worst depression bout I’ve ever had.I started citalopram and dealt with VERY heightened anxiety and depression, It was the worst and I asked my husband everyday this is going to work, right?. I would read reviews and count down the minutes and the days.A little over 4 months later and I was feeling back to my regular self! So blessed that I didn’t wait any longer before starting citalopram.You will 100% know if you need medication, there will be no other way out besides not being here anymore. Get help! I’ve now been on citalopram for 9 months and around month 4 I started eating all the carbs and sugar I could get my hands on and continue doing so. This is problematic and making a doctor appointment to discuss what to do. I workout everyday and am active, but it’s no match for the carbs. When I first started the medication it made me lose 15 pounds.

Celexa (citalopram):I took Celexa one night.   Dr prescribed me 15 mg.  I cut that in half & then cut in half again, so I only took 2.5 mg that night.   When woke the next day, I could barely walk I was that dizzy.  Nauseated beyond belief & my heart was pounding out of my chest with anxiety.  I just had to stay in bed all day.  I honestly thought I was going to need to go to the hospital!   I know with SSRI’s, you’ll need to get through 2-4 weeks before you feel better, but my experience on such a small dose, I can’t imagine going that long feeling like that!   I have a hard time on SSRI’s & basically had similar reactions.  I guess they’re not for me.  Going to try a more natural way out of this

Truly excellent - after the first week(s)I’ve been on citalopram now 3 times in the last 15 years for anxiety attacks and relapses with anxiety. Each time it has been incredibly helpful in getting me back to myself. I started back on it last week after a relapse. However, this time the first week was very hard. Peaks and attacks in anxiety were through the roof to the point I thought about going to hospital. My GP prescribed me diazepam to have as something to offset the attacks which fortunately seemed to help, just knowing they were there. Whether these attacks were a side effect of the drugs or not, I think it was. After maybe 8-9 days the anxiety attacks subsided to the point my wife said the change In you is incredible. I think now I am happy to be on it for long term. My experience: Be prepared for a rough time while your body adjusts but ultimately this medication can help. Good luck x

On citalopram for  8 days  @ 10mg. It has not been too bad, anxiety went really high at times and nausea a few times. Sweaty hands and feet. Still not any better yet. Waiting for being able to go asleep without anxiety and wake up with out anxiety.

Well, I'm glad to read other peoples comments regarding side effects going away after a while.  I've been on 10mg for a week now.  I think I feel worst than when I started to take the meds.  I sleep all the time, seem to have difficulty regulating the body heat (cold/hot/cold/hot).  I feel my heart beating faster at times, I get loss of breaths....  And I have less motivation than ever.

Celexa (citalopram):I've been on Celexa almost five months. It automatically took away the maniac depression, but it took two and a half months for the anxiety to calm down.  I did have the suicidal thoughts and I still have muscle tremors from the medication but I haven't been this calm since high school! I love this medication.

Been taking this for over a year it makes me a lot more stable. I’ve tried reducing dosage but I get too agitated and anxious so I’m low key worried I’m addicted to this but life is better than without it.

4 weeks on citalopram was on 20mg, now  started taking just 10mg now and I feel the same effects as I was on the 20mg. My  anxiety totally gone away can fall asleep on a night and sleep through fully, chest pains are lighter now and not fully paining me. And the feeling of a lump in my throat as gone so hopefully soon depending if my chest pains completely go away I will cut my citalopram to 5mg. It has only been on the 4 weeks today and I was completely a mess for months pains anxiety not sleeping much got to say am feeling almost back to my normal self.

So I started 20mg I’m on day 3, I’m feeling so sick, dizzy and like I’m not in my own body, I’ve been having the feeling of not being able to take a deep breath down, my anxiety is extremely high, when am I going to feel normal again, I swear I can’t take anymore.

I have been living with a debilitating condition that has caused me to have total breakdown severe anxiety and depression. I was put on citralopram at 10 mg at first After 4/5 weeks I felt no benefit at all . So doctor increased to 20 mg after five more weeks I felt no relief at all , increased anxiety and developed severe depression . Doctor increased dose to 30mg  had no relief and was getting frantic . Felt suicidal after 7 weeks I felt no relief whatsoever, I was increased to 40 mg after 3 weeks I had enough as I have gone so down hill. I am now having to wean off of it after no benefit whatsoever. A complete nightmare !!! I once took sertraline at the lowest possible dose of 25 mg it worked very well I had peace. I couldn’t take it this time at all as I had chest pains with it which is how I ended up on citalopram. Citalopram has been the most horrific experience I wish I’d never ever taken it. I do not recommend whatsoever . I do not know what to do now

I started taking citalopram several months ago when my oldest son passed away At first I thought they were helping me but then I felt much worse than before I started taking the tablet which was the 20mg strength.My doctor advised me to double the dose Before I knew it I was falling to sleep all the time except night time. My legs, ankles and feet swollen very badly I couldn’t at times stay awake.I would continually jerk all the time as well, I did throw drinks over myself - thank god they weren’t still boiling. They made me miserable not one shoe or boot would go on my foot. I rang the doctor and told her I was not going to take anymore. Each day since then I am gradually getting rid off all those side effects my swelling has taken 2 weeks to go down to a reasonable sizeThere were also several more minor side effects

Day 15 on citalopram 20mg so far so good. Pains in my back have gone and my chest pains are on and off now which was constant for 4 months. Still have the sensation that there's something in my throat hoping that goes soon I feel much calmer. So overall these tables have been okay so far with me. I sat looking at them for 3 weeks before taking my first one was scared to take them but enough was enough. I had not been able to leave my house and consequently thinking something is going to happen to me, not been able to sleep so in end thought I had nothing to lose trying these tablets and am so happy that I did.
Day 6 still no sleep nausea and headache. Had a bit of a panic this morning as thought my heart rate was slow. Hope I start to feel good soon x

Celexa (citalopram):Week 5 & I feel human again.I had all of the side effects, increased anxiety, panic attacks, no appetite, diarrhoea, headache, nausea & just not feeling connected to my brain (really spacey) but today is week 5 & I actually laughed & felt a lot better! I prayed that I would feel some light & it’s here. I’m glad I didn’t give up, I thought I’d feel awful forever but they’re definitely working & I feel like my old self again.

Hello. Am 10 days on citalopram had few bad symptoms to start with but nearly over now. I couldn't sleep felt tired but every time I was nodding off had wake myself you by jumping and feeling like I couldn't breath, but for past 2 nights have been able to sleep no problem there. I can now leave my house and go to the shop on my own with out feeling like am going to faint and feeling scared something bad is going to happen. I am still suffering tight chest pains and back pains and the feeling of something in my throat so am going to still it out and carry on citalopram 20mg  to see if my chest pains and throat and back getting better in time with these fingers crossed.

Have been dealing with anxiety/panic attacks/PTSD for years and doctor thought this would help with the stuff I was still struggling with. The nausea lasted about a week or so but did go away. Now I have no appetite at all. Like eating one small meal a day, if anything at all, it has made anxiety much worse, especially when first waking up. Will be asking to try something else as I know body chemistry is different for everyone.
Hi there I have been taking Celepram for just over two weeks but haven't had any positive changes yet how long does it take to see some changes in mood?

Hello. So I visited hospital around 4-5 times in just a little over a week I was on the phone to my own g.p but felt like I wasn't getting any where. I was left 4 months until the hospital run so many tests on me a barium swallow. Then a e.c.g and my bloods taken. And also had a CT scan all in which came back clear. I was suffering really bad headaches then I couldn't swallow my on saliva then I felt although I had a lump in my throat things got worse, I had chest pains, back pains, I was always so tense, I felt scared, I didn't know what was wrong with me. I begged the hospital to help me I wasn't sleeping and if I did start to fall in to sleep I was jumping out my sleep. Then I was in the hospital and I started having a full blown panic attack with that they had someone talk to me and they said I had depression and anxiety and was put on citalopram 20mg.

I keep searching for someone who has had similar side effects to the ones that I am experiencing at the moment.I have started on 10mg Citalopram and have been on these for only 2 weeks.  I felt a difference in my depression and worry, at about Day 10.  However, have had awful lower back pain (I never get back pain), and my thighs are swollen and ache.  I have a healthy diet and have changed nothing since I started these.  Also, I'm exhausted and whilst I feel more like doing things, I could fall asleep standing up.   As an aside, I had my first Covid (AstraZeneca) vaccination on Monday.  I had no pain in the injection site at all but I'm wondering if the back pain could be due to that.   I've asked a GP at the health centre and he hasn't a clue.   I'm pretty sure it's the Citalopram that's causing it.  I'm thinking of going down to 5mg even though I know this is a tiny dose and for children, but there's no way I could deal with this pain and inflammation for long.
This literally makes me care about nothing especially not myself

I am writing this at 5am in the morning. I have been off citalopram 20mg for over 6 weeks now and I am still waking up in the middle of the night. Also my penis feels weak and dead because there isn't a lot of blood flow. Citalopram and SSRIs in general are garbage and have ruined my quality of life.

I was prescribed 10mg citalopram on 17th December for anxiety and panic attacks. After 6 weeks of hardly any improvement I was upped to 20mg. The side effects have been awful. Hot and cold sweats. Heart palpitations. Heightened anxiety. Will this pass? I just want to feel better

Celexa (citalopram):10 years ago I had a lot of things going on at home and work and was very stressed! I was having chest pain and headaches every day. I was started on Celexa 10mg - that stopped my chest pain I was then increased to 20mg and that stopped my headaches. I still have times when I feel overwhelmed and I have Xanax for those times when I feel I’m about to lose it! I do feel that sometimes I don’t care enough about some things. My husband makes sure I don’t run out. He calls them my "Be so much nicer to my husband pills"

I started citalopram (celexa) 3 nights ago and it has already saved my life. For the past 3 years I’ve experienced the worst physical symptoms of anxiety/panic : nausea, vomiting, aching stomach, heart palpitations, etc. The worst part for me is no appetite and weight loss (I’m already small). I first tried escitalopram (lexapro) but my symptoms still lingered, so my doctor switched me to venlafaxine which took away my appetite and made me feel numb / no apathy whatsoever so out of frustration I weaned myself off... I was symptom free for 4 months and then out of nowhere last month my physical symptoms came back like a wave- nausea & vomiting, upset stomach, heart palpitations, I couldn’t eat. After ending up in the ER I demanded to be put back on another medication and my doctor prescribed citalopram. I have had 0 side effects besides slightly drowsy after taking it and an increased appetite. I feel extremely calm and like my normal self.

I took citalopram when I was 17-20 years old and am now back on it a few years later. I got off the medication because I didn’t like having to take medication. This was silly. I was fine for about 18 months, and then I experienced my anxiety in a new way, panic attacks. I had intrusive suicidal thoughts even though I love life and find joy and happiness all the time. I managed the strength to ask to be back on the medication. I felt basically no effects until week 3-4, so don’t give up. I’m now on week 4 of being on the medication for a second time, and the benefits are here. I’m so glad I’ve stuck it out, because I can finally see the light at the end of the tunnel.  Some side effects I’ve noticed: Slightly increased anxiety, headaches, dizziness, feeling a little spacey, decreased libido, diarrhea, vivid dreams, yawning. All of these side effects have improved drastically, or are gone completely. I expect them all to fade by the time Everything evens out. I take 20mg.

Celexa (citalopram):I'd taken celexa 10mg in my teens. I got off celexa when I reached my 20s. At 26 years old that's when panic attacks started. It was so bad I couldn't leave house as I was afraid I would get dizzy and faint if I went any where. I started back on celexa, not sure if I was 20mg or 10mg. Because DR. prescribed 20mg but I think I cut them in half to 10mg. Celexa worked great, the attacks had went away. From what I remember I had no side effects from taking Celexa before. I took it for 2 years and got off. I'm now 32 years old and the panic attacks started again. Today is my 2nd day on celexa 20mg. Side effects are horrible. I feel weird and having panic attacks. Hands, feet sweat, trembling, heart racing, numbness. I've been reading reviews of others are going through the same and they are saying to stick through it as it's great outcome. I called Dr and suggested I half pill to 10mg and take at night instead of morning. I pray for all those facing this battle. We'll get through this in Jesus name.

Had to come off Citalopram, psychologically it helped and took away the feeling of being overwhelmed. However, the side effects were not getting any better. Sore, tingling back of head, jaw pain when chewing, rapid heartbeat,  sweaty hands, headaches, no appetite .... It is a no from me.

Celexa (citalopram):I had a few bad anxiety attacks and my doctor put me on Zoloft which was the worse experience with a medication I’ve ever had. I had ton of side effects and despised the drug. The doctor urged me to try celexa and I’m  so glad I did. I’ve had zero side effects while on this anxiety medicine and never felt better. I’ve had one episode since I’ve been on this I felt that I was getting stressed but that was short lived. I have completely stopped worrying about little things I shouldn’t be worrying about and my anxiety levels are almost zero. It’s amazing things that I use to stress about doesn’t even bother me anymore. So glad I tried this medication.

I took citalopram for 2.5 years (10mg dose) until I stopped this November. Before citalopram my life was in shambles. I was shaky, felt like I was always going to faint, dizzy, fast heart rate, depressed, and avoided public gatherings at all costs. The last 2.5 years have been fairly good despite family/school stress. It wasn’t until this October/November that I felt like I didn’t need citalopram anymore and I gradually stopped. Near the middle of November I experienced my first real panic attack (slurred speech, unable to type, lost feeling in my arm, unable to recall the names of my own pets) it was traumatizing. Went to the hospital and received a clean MRI. I decided to start citalopram again since I have 1.5 years left of college and these last 9 days have been ROUGH. I have depersonalization, anxiety, fear of dying, loss of appetite, you name it. I knew it helped these last few years so I’m sticking it out in hopes of feeling normal again. I’m taking 10mg again.
8th day on this drug and it’s horrible.  I feel no change whatsoever I haven’t been able to get out of bed, I have  no motivation, suppressed appetite, dizzy.... I’m not taking this rubbish anymore!!

Began Citalopram 10mg 3 months ago. After the first 4 weeks increased to 20mg. Best decision I made. I had been experiencing intrusive negative thoughts causing high levels of anxiety, I  was waking every night and unable to get back to sleep. The symptoms got worse and I became suicidal. Some days I would be emotionally unstable for a few hours and then feel better later on. After months I decided to go on Citalopram. The first week I was sleeping all through the day, concentration was limited and I had no appetite. I didn't notice any improvement but continued. The dose was increased to 20mg and within a week I noticed small changes. Gradually i began to feel like my normal self again. I'm happy, confident and able to think clearly. I have gained a little weight but if the medication is working I dont care. I have had many other antidepressants over the years (last medicated 8 years ago) and none have worked as fast and been as effective. This medication has literally saved my life.

HiI started citalopram 4 days ago and have had terrible diarrhoea and stomach pains along with feeling dizzy. By the looks of the reviews this is very common? I’m hoping this drug helps as I've never taken antidepressants before as always opted for the natural / therapy route for the last 17 years. I've suffered since I was 16 now 33. But think this year has tipped me off my edge with losing my dad in May 2020 and then stressed from work and then all this Covid virus just made me ten times worse to a point I got gastritis and can’t even sit in the car for 5 mins without tensing up and feeling awful with pains and panicking and reaching for a diazapram. I really hope this tablet works  as it is awful how bad I've got in the last few months with my anxieties

Started on citalopram after my IBS symptoms would not settle. Tried 10mg as a last resort. My IBS is completely gone but I also feel so much less stressed. Things that would have upset me are now like water on a ducks back. My job is stressful and last year I found it very hard. This year with citalopram I feel like I can cope with pretty much anything. I feel great mentally and physically and I haven’t noticed any side effects. I tell everyone that I’m on a miracle drug!

I've been blessed to not have many of the side effects for citalopram. The primary one I DO have is that of basically numb genitals. Climaxing is a thing of the past.I didn't realize how much citalopram has been helping my anxiety and stress until I tried to stop taking it, as I have some upcoming meds that aren't supposed to be mixed with it. After about a week of not taking citalopram, I was back to being certain that I shouldn't stay alive anymore. Went back on them, and I seem to be much better again. I still am depressed, and I still have anxiety, especially for the first hour I'm awake in the morning. But I'm alive, so yippee.

Celexa (citalopram):I started Celexa during COVID-19. I always had high anxiety but COVID pushed me over the edge. My anxiety got to the point that I ended up in the hospital with a panic attack. My doctor started me on 20 mg of Celexa. The side effects were a little rough at first and included nausea, some random spasms, trouble sleeping and a feeling of falling shortly after sleep. However, after about 2 weeks they subsided. The positive far out weigh the negatives. My anxiety is under control now. I'm able to live my life without constant worry. Things that used to be major stressors are now tolerable. I sometimes have to be a little careful because I feel like I'm too comfortable and don't worry enough. The one major long term side effect has been the lack of sex drive. Everything functions fine but my drive has been greatly reduced. I also feel like my emotions are slightly muted whereas before I was felt emotions very deeply, now they are slightly less intense.

Started on 5 mg citalopram then up to 10mg after a week, side effects was bad for a few weeks mainly feeling hot and sick but that has settled down. I would say not to take them at night time as I did and could not sleep, so changed to taking them with food in the morning with breakfast.I feel so much better in my self feel like me again and my sense of humour has returned.My anxiety has got better and I can now go out alone and face house hold chores without it being overwhelming.I am now on 20mg and coping with stress better.

Celexa (citalopram):Celexa didn’t work for me and my anxiety and depression. I bore with the side effects for four weeks (splitting headaches, inability to sleep or stay asleep, night sweats, cold symptoms, a feeling of dis-reality I hadn’t previously had, loss of all libido, skin numbness and feeling drained of all energy) but they did not begin to alleviate. I thought nothing could be worse than the depression and anxiety but I was wrong. The treatment in this case was worse than the condition. Now tapering off and trying something different.

I was prescribed these citalopram pills on August 31st 2020 for anxiety and stress. I was prescribed to take half a 20mg dose for my anxiety I did so at about 3-4pm I was okay went along with my day went to bed. I woke up at midnight with a nasty burning sensation in my head and my left eye was going fuzzy the burning feeling in my head.  It literally felt like someone set my head on fire from the inside that’s is only on 1 half of a 20mg Pill. We are now on Sept 4th 2020 I have not been able to drive, my anxiety has been worse, my head has been messed up with a burning sensation and numbness in my head and face, my eyes have been sore and heavy I have been a couch potato. I have 3 children that are 6 years and under I am a stay at home mother. I was not aware that this is a sedative (my first time ever taking antidepressant) I went to the hospital they said I was fine and to keep taking the pills the doctor who prescribed them said the same I was so scared to take them I never ended up taking another.. worst experience ever I am still not 100% better today

I took my first Citalopram pill early this morning.  Within an hour I was sweating like crazy,  severe diarrhoea like 20 times today.  I have eaten virtually nothing all day as I feel too sick.  I have drunk litres of water because of a dry mouth, and probably fluid loss.I will not be taking any more of them.

I was prescribed citalopram for panic attacks and anxiety after a divorce. I started on a dose of 10mg for a week then went on to 20mg for another 6 weeks before stopping completely. It made me feel completely numb and confused, I felt nothing towards others. I was forgetting things and my anxiety didn't go away, all I could think was what would happen if I wanted to come off them. I had no sex drive and I did put on weight. I felt nothing and didn't recognise myself. Awful drug for me

I have been taking this citalopram medication since last year summer 2019. Each time I have taken it, it has really helped me calm down for my anxiety. This year I have been taking it since February as I started feeling anxious and weird again. Like I feel like I don't know where I am and what room I'm in and overthink any little unwell feeling I get. Particularly with my nose throat and chest. It has been so much better these last 6 months however these last few days I feel anxious again and I do not know why. Does this mean I need to increase my dose or just carry on with the 20mg I have been taking these past few months?
It doesn’t cure anxiety but it  Helps manage it with other lifestyle and cognitive changes.

Celexa (citalopram):I started this medication in 2009 and started with 20mg. Last summer I went down to 10 mg. I started off ok and was still having some anxiety. Fast forward to March 28, 2020 and I had a full blown panic attack and thought I was dying. This happened at 3:00 am. I had my husband call 911. Thought I was having a heart attack. I started the next day on 20 mg. It’s. Now been over 7 weeks and I’m not 100 % but I’m doing so much better. You have to bare with the some symptoms, headache, A little off. Hold on it will get better, I promise. This anxiety and panic attacks, I wouldn’t wish on anyone! Take care of yourself. Also use an app to help you stay calm.

Celexa (citalopram):This medication brought me out of such a dark place. I have struggled with severe anxiety which had manifested into  severe depression so I started 20mg of celexa at night. At first I took 10mg for one week and let me tell you, my side effects were AWFUL. I couldn’t sleep, my anxiety was horrific, I had brain fog all day, and my brain was going a mile a minute. However, after 2 or 3 weeks the side effects went away almost completely, and now I have none. I am so much less anxious of a person, and just overall way more happy and outgoing! I used to be so anxious about everything but now I feel like I can handle whatever is thrown my way! So yes while the first couple weeks can be horrific, for me it was all worth it as this medication truely does work!
