I spent 6 months deciding whether or not to start taking medication. I had a range of concerns (especially as the forum tell a wide range of experiences). I am happy that I have started taking Citalopram and although it has only been 3-4 weeks I have noticed an on-going change. At first I had bouts of feeling VERY tired (lasted an hour plus) and then felt confused and hazy. Still able to function but a little removed. I did find that my anxiety was raised from time to time, but things have leveled off and I find that I feel the same without the same amount of stress/anxiety. I feel more like my younger self. I still care about things, but can be more relaxed. I used to be a little compulsive/anxious and now have a more balanced perspective. I don't feel as stressed or upset about things that would (and shouldn't) stress/upset me.I would recommend Citalopram and would suggest that if you start taking it that you need to prepare for sticking with it for at least 4 weeks.

68 years old. Been on a dose of 10 mg citalopram for 6 months - gradually felt better after 6 weeks. Still had a few panic attacks and excessive yawning/stress headaches. After 6 months  I feel much improved so the Dr suggested I up to 20 mg as he thinks it will help even more. So..I’ll let you know how I make out..I’m very optimistic..

Celexa (citalopram):So, I was first on Celexa from 2001 till 2016 I felt it wasn't working so my dr prescribed Venlafaxine/Effexor XR.  I ended up in the emergency room with a heart rate of 185bpm. Anyway.....I should have just stuck with Celexa.  I am back on it after trying Prozac which made me nauseous for a year and gave me more anxiety.  Celexa works for me.  It takes away my anxiety.  Its safe for me and I'll never go off of it or try another again. These past two years have been so bad. Getting off of Effexor brought me to my knees.

Celexa (citalopram):To update from my last review:I've been taking it for a month now.  I did only take half (the 5 MG) for a week and now I'm on the 10.   I'm finding my moods to be SO much better already and I can describe my feeling as being "lighter"... like a grey cloud that was over me for whatever reason is just lighter and I'm more excited to do social things again.  A relationship made my anxiety worse, then I would be moody, that would cause issues and it was a cycle so this has really helped my home life and work life too as things don't bother me.  I will say ... I do feel less motivated at work - I guess just a side affect.  My highs are still high tho, my lows just aren't as low.  I'm friendlier and more positive at work (I just don't feel like doing that much of the boring monotony). Lastly, I can't tell a difference in my sex drive which is good.  If you're anxious or moody, or just feel some heavy unexplained cloud, I definitely recommend trying this!

Celexa (citalopram):Okay so this is my first day taking it and it’s crazy I already feel a difference in my group today I was talking like crazy and wasn’t nervous at all and I feel like I have sooo much energy but I’m also tied bc I haven’t been sleeping bc of how much stress I’ve been under so I’ll update Next Wednesday to see how it is! I’m so excited to not feel so nervous all the time and depressed I’m so happy!

Celexa (citalopram):I've been on this for a week.  The first night I took it I felt really, really high but pretty anxious too so I cut the tablet  in half for 6 days and on the 8th, took a full (10 MG).  When I cut in half for 5 MG, had no sleep issues, when I take 10mg I do have sleep issues and I do have an anxious chest - not jittery but my stomach and chest feel anxious like I've had too much coffee except the rest of me is still tired.  After the first night though, I could already tell in my mood swings and I'm sticking with it.  It's not unbearable by any means but I'll check back in after another week to update you!  I would say ... if your side effects are so strong, cut it in half and wait another week.  Almost every negative review is about the first week or two - make it through that, eat healthy and force yourself to exercise (even if you're tired from not sleeping thoroughly the night before).  I believe the long term affects will be totally worth a week of feeling antsy.

Celexa (citalopram):I found it helpful. After about 2 weeks my anxiety lessened and now into the 4th week, appetite is better, mood better.  Still not where I want to be but overall I’m better.  Still have trouble sleeping some nights.  Also my mind will race at times.

My GP put me on this citalopram for social anxiety disorder. My first psych med and diagnoses. At first it helped calm me down. I didn’t feel like running around my house starting a million projects (ADHD). I got used to that after a short period and it started to stimulate me more and more (bipolar 2) which led me to max out the dose. Don’t remember what exactly led up to it (hypomanic episode) but spiralled into a bad depression that lasted a couple of months until I was switched to Escitalopram.  Overall effectiveness for anxiety was minimal.

Celexa (citalopram):I've held high positions mainly in the field of Human Services; somewhere down the line, my demanding jobs affected my concentration in addition to other stressors in my personal life really done a number to my mental and emotional wellbeing overtime.  I feel perfectly sane, my main concern is my inability to focus. I'm a week into Celexa; so far so good, my thoughts aren't so scattered as they were prior to treatment. I feel more calm and gradually feeling like my old self. I am comfortable to holding long conversations as opposed to before.  I'm quite pleased with this medication.

Celexa (citalopram):Just wanna know I’ve taken Celexa 2 years ago for 3 to 4 months and after I felt like I was fixed! Fast forward to now and my anxiety has never been as bad as it is now... so I’m back on celexa day 5 and I get this crazy heart beat feeling in my chest and crazy hot flashes feels like my skin is burning.. I just wanna know if it gets any better because I didn’t have this the first time. Can anyone relate to the side effects I’m having

Well, I've been off and on with different meds. After trying Lexapro, buspirone, and other meds for my depression I finally decided to go back to celexa. Going back was the best idea ever, my head is more clear, my mood is definitely more stable and this time I didn't get the shakes or my heart speeding up. I do take other meds with this that also help. However on my first dose now and  slept really well which is weird because I remember not being able to sleep before on it. If it causes issues with your sleep speak to your doctor. I'm on lunesta and seraquel. Good luck to those trying it for the first time.

Celexa (citalopram):I've been on Celexa for a week at a dose of 10mg, and it has been a huge difference, I feel like a different person. It has helped me with my ADHD symptoms. I used to be so anxious I couldn't do work, I didn't want to leave the house, I was late for everything, and now I can focus better and not obsess about my performance at work. The first night I got so confused and self conscious but the next day I woke up earlier and with more energy and could function so much better. I am still getting used to it. The way I see it is my brain is relearning how to feel everything, my skin feels weird sometimes, the cold feels different, and my emotions and anxiety (which is still there but manageable), is different. I can still feel things like love, and connection, joy, sadness, guilt, and I can. They are just all less intense and it makes more room for me being able to feel good most days.

I have MDD and GAD, as well as ADD and PTSD. I was on put on 20mg for a while, and it was the first SSRI that felt like it actually improved my mood. Fast forward a year and I’m still getting weepy over minor slights- usually in public, still having intrusive suicidal thoughts, and brain still feels on about 35% go. I upped from 20-40mgs at the suggestion of my doc and was the shift was almost immediate. -*Everything* has changed for the better. I don’t get stressed out- I can still feel my emotions but they don’t knock me down- I can cope- I was thinking this is what normal must feel like, in addition, no suicidal thoughts and my memory seems to be improving, but I have been taking a medical grade fish oil- so that might be helping too. I wish I had done this for myself two years ago, but I was stubborn and didn’t want any more meds than I had to take- but the quality of my life has just gone up so much in a such a short period of time.

Celexa (citalopram):Been dealing with uncontrollable anxiety & nervous breakdowns,,, now 23 & I guess life is hitting me head on & just not comfortable as I want to be. Anxiety been uncontrollable. Friend recommended celexa, so  I saw my Doctor and I’m trying it. On Day 2. But & reading reviews & a lot of 1 stars where people seem to have bad experiences. Wondering if I should stick with it or not....
Actavis citalopram not available and I have been given accord brand. It is not the same I am  crying more
It has helped me to control stress and anxiety. I have a better mood and can cope well. I also sleep better as I was going days without sleeping properly.

I suffered from depression and anxiety, I tried almost everything then finally put on citalopram. When I was  put on it initially 20 mg first few days my anxiety and depression heightened a bit but as it cross 6 weeks everything is like before...thanks to my gp.
Had anxiety on and off for 30 years been taking this at 10mg for 2 years I feel normal again no panic attacks. Takes time around 8-10 weeks, but works just stick it out

Celexa (citalopram):I had a stroke and started having anxiety so my doctor started me on Lexapro which worked very well but after a couple months I came off of it. A month later the anxiety came back and so my new doctor gave me celexa, it did stop my anxiety but the side effects are much worse than lexapro. My memory is horrible, my energy is not good and the brain fog is aggravating. so I'm going to come off celexa and go back to lexapro.

Citalopram helped me with depression but it has a bad side effect which is the tinnitus ,it is really a nightmare, hissing all over my head, I can not sleep, feel dizzy most the time, please stay away from it if you can.

Started on citalopram at a dose of  10 mg and then went on to 20mg. Started to feel better after 3 mouthsDecided to come of it bad - mistake You need to be on it long time. Maybe a year 18 months.Any way I  went back on it up to 30 mgthen about a year later dropped  my dose to 20 mg Feel like I am getting my life back. I can't tell you how good it feels, just stick it out you are going to get better on citalopram

I’ve been taking Citilopram for 8 months and it did work for me for my anxiety but my memory, usually good, has become very bad. I haven’t gained weight. You must only drink in moderation. Taste buds have changed. Lately I’ve had my social anxiety back and because I dread Christmas anyway they haven’t helped me over this period. They are worth taking but I’m due a review of them in the new year which is timely.

Anyone thinking of trying this drug for anxiety, I would urge you to give it a go.  I was very apprehensive about taking antidepressants, but after struggling with peri-menopausal night sweats and horrendous intrusive anxious thoughts, I had to do something.  I'm so glad I did.  My anxious thoughts have completely stopped and the night sweats have become very occasional and far less intense after about 10 weeks. At first I experienced most side effects, but I'd urge anyone to stick with it  and start on a low dose (I'm on 10mg). I had horrible insomnia for a few nights and a 'woolly' headache for a week and a very dry mouth. However, all these side effects have disappeared and the benefits massively outweigh the few days I had no sleep!  My concentration levels are so improved, I'm no longer irritable, no sweats and most important of all, no horrible anxious thoughts which were affecting my work, my marriage and my ability just to enjoy life.  P.S no problems with sexual climax either!

Celexa (citalopram):I started taking Citalopram about about 3 weeks ago for high blood pressure, increasing panic attacks, and generalized inability to keep my adrenaline down to healthy levels.  I've been fighting my doctor about taking mood altering medication because I've been on the slew of Prozac, Paxil, Effexor, etc. a couple of decades ago.  They didn't help and withdrawal was horrific. I am so glad that he talked me into trying Citalopram.  The first day was really rough - gastrointestinal issues that rivalled my IBS, but ALL day.  However, by the second and third day, that went away and a feeling of general well-being started to replace the panic.  It's only been a few weeks, and I know many of the guides say you won't notice a difference right away, but I was lucky.  I did start to notice a change after 1 week.  So far, it's just this side of miraculous for me.  I think I'd forgotten what hope and happiness felt like.

I've always had a fear about becoming dependant on meds so I never took them. However I was diagnosed with anxiety and was prescribed 20mg citalopram hydrobromide (celexa) back in 2014 and never took them out of fear and poured them out. Now fast forward to 2019 I'm a typical happy guy but after military started feeling I couldn't get that kick out life anymore. Insecurities, not feeling good enough for my wife, anti social with people and friends, just downer stuff. Docs prescribed 20mg of Celexa...

Started the med citalopram back in September after going through a year of meditation, therapy and exercise and realized I needed more help for my anxiety and stress. I had panic attack back in 2018 that really put me in a bad place, this drug has helped me a lot! I don’t obsess as much, my kids and hubby have seen an improvement..I’m only on 10mg and I may go up eventually we’ll see.  The only side effects for me extremely tired and a lot loopy...but I’ll take it. I should have taken these a long time ago!

Celexa (citalopram):Before starting Celexa I would get so anxious I couldn’t think straight ever & almost felt like I was high on drugs. I would panic almost every single day & was only eating a few hundred calories daily (all due to a breakup). Started on  10mg & after that moved up to 20mg. I had diarrhea & a bit of an upset stomach the first two weeks but after that it was gone. After a month the difference in my anxiety was astonishing so I stayed on 20mg. After 2 months I noticed I was still anxious about the breakup (constant thoughts were always in the background). Doctor upped my dosage to 40mg. My anxiety stayed about the same but my depression got much worse. Still having 24/7 background thoughts on the breakup so I’m now on Zoloft and trying that. Celexa may not have worked 100% for me but it made a huge  difference from where I was a few months ago so I’m thankful. I got pretty much zero side effects except for a bit of affected sleep. Would recommend as a good starter SSRI.
Celexa (citalopram):I have been taking Celexa for years due to anxiety and stress from chronic pain. At first it seemed ineffective but as time went on I do not want to be without it.

Celexa (citalopram):I have been using celexa for a few weeks and I have seen a dramatic change in my anxiety and stress levels. Before taking this I would wake up every single morning in a state of panic and anxiety and since taking celexa I feel calm and alive again I can function I feel like I finally have my life back I feel like myself again. I feel soo wonderful!!!!!!!
Celexa (citalopram):Why does celexa causes anxiety and aggravated and screaming nervousness?  Why do I itch all over my body?

The Pro :I've been on 40mg citalopram for 8 years now. I can safely say, it's done the trick. 95% of the time, my mood is great and my conditions are few and far between, friends and family have seen a huge difference.The Con:It's weakened my stomach lining and I get heart burn quite often. Tend to run out of energy by 3pm'ish each day. If I miss more than 3 days, I'll get extreme head pains and be dizzy (very unpleasant, set reminders).My Advise:It took my body around 5-6 months to adjust and actually work as intended, don't expect it to be a magic pill that will fix you in a few weeks.. give it time to work. Expect some sort of side effect to appear at some point, the pro out weighs the cons hugely though!Keep your chin up :)
I have been taking these for 10 years they are wonderful made my anxiety and depression go away ran out few weeks ago for 3 days went back to old feelings god send for me

I was prescribed 20mg of Citalopram by my doctor for anxiety caused by intrusive thoughts. In all honesty, the first time I took it I felt absolutely worse and I felt like I didn’t have any hope at feeling alive again because I had being so consumed in my anxiety that I couldn’t see any light any more. I started on 20mg then went down to 10mg because of rapid heart rates, shivers and poor sleep. By the 4th day, I noticed a change in my mood and my crying spells reduced and I no longer cry anymore. My body got used to the drug. If you’re taking Citalopram please have some patience.. you will be okay!! This drug has given me so much hope and I’m grateful!

So it’s my first day taking Citalopram so have no comments yet. My one concern is how it affects your skin? Has anyone had any issues with acne developing? I struggle with adult acne and concerned this may flare up due to this medication. I understand my mental state is so much more important just want to be prepared if this is a side affect...although I'm thinking less stress should help??

Hello all,I was prescribed 10 mg per day of  citalopram in June this year for anxiety. I never felt good on them and around the 20th October decided to cut the tablet in half as I wanted to cut them out gradually and come off them to see if I felt better. I stopped taking them completely 5 days ago and I feel a lot better in myself. I firmly believe that citalopram is not good for everyone and they 100% made me feel worse!I hope this post helps anyone in a similar position
Celexa (citalopram):Celexa was prescribed for me after cancer treatments and it has made the most positive difference in my life.  I feel alive again.

This citalopram has completely changed my life! I was sad, angry and insecure before I took this medicine.  After a week, I felt like a new women. I feel amazing and I don't even get angry anymore. I'm as cool as a cucumber. This is worth everything.

My daughter has been prescribed citalopram for anxiety and depression. She has been on it for 10 weeks. This medication has made her much worse. She has been through hell these last few week hoping it work eventually work. The panic attacks and social anxiety had multiplied 10 fold. Be careful taking these I’m shock how these have affected her.

Celexa (citalopram):I just recently increased my dose, I was unsure how it would effect me but after talking with him I was willing to try. The more I have to fight back my extreme anxiety with the better. It’s been about 5 weeks since increasing my dose. And I just want to see I feel like ME again. The happy go lucky girl I remember being. I still have bouts of anxiety but that’s Natural, there’s no magic pill that removes it forever. I think the best way to say how it helps my anxiety is it changes my mood and the way I process things. I feel joyful when normally I would be frantic, I find myself engaging in settings I normally would be anxious and insecure. Going to this dose was the best choice I could’ve made! Everyone is different you just have to start low on the amount of dose and see how you feel!

Celexa (citalopram):I’m 23 years old & began to have severe GAD due to a stressful situation. I felt worthless, depressed, anxious, & pessimistic. I decided to go to my doctor & was prescribed Celexa. I experienced a low appetite, insomnia , & mild diarrhea the first couple weeks. I also had increased mood swings. The adjustment period was rough! However, after about 6-8 weeks I started to level out & had less  anxiety. Now I can say that my anxiety is about 90% cured! I have been taking this medicine for about 2-3 months. I still experience some anxiety during normal moments that I should experience some anxiety, but it’s NOTHING compared to where I used to be. I can still feel my emotions, the lows are just not as low anymore . I’m going through a break up right now & I can honestly say that although I’ve had sad moments I am still fully functioning & I am still managing to be happy with my life. Thank you Celexa!

My GP started me off on 20 mg Citalopram but after a few days I felt so rough that I started taking a half dose (with GP guidance). I had brain fog and extreme fatigue for the first two weeks, however in that time my anxiety also started to lessen. I decided to persevere despite the unpleasant head feeling and tiredness (also had some headaches) and after 3 weeks or so my head had cleared considerably. 4 weeks on I’m still on 10 mg and feeling good. I think this is the right medication for me. I experimented with taking it at different times of day, and I find it’s best for me taken at bedtime.

I'm on week 1 of this 10mg celexa and  I haven't felt anything yet. I had a meeting today and I was extremely nervous and felt like I was going to have a panic attack an hour before it started. I drank a lot of coffee and got dehydrated so I had to pair it with an equivalent amount of water in order to feel ready to go.Overall the meeting went well. I think it did help overall. The conversation went smoother than usual. (:It usually takes 1 to 6 weeks for this too fully kick in. Hang in there!
I have been taking Activas brand  of citalopram for 3 years and at the moment in UK is unavailable.  The other brands make me have awful side effects so does anyone know if Teva brand is the same?

Celexa (citalopram):I just started Celexa 4 days ago. I started feeling something the first day I took it, a feeling of calmness. Which I barely have ever.  I took zofran the first 3 days because I didn’t want to get nauseous. Well 4th day I thought I could do without the Zofran but turns out that’s a no. Other than that, it seems to be working, I hope this is a winner in my book, god know I need it.

I started Celexa mostly for generalized anxiety and panic attacks. I started on 10mg and felt better immediately. The first coupe of days I experienced some euphoria and diarrhea but that went away quickly. I also had insomnia for the first month or so. I've slowly increased my dose and now, after about 4 months, I take 40mg daily. This medication has changed my life. I no longer worry about silly things or get upset over nothing. My anger is better, my back pain has improved, and my focus and concentration have improved. However, since increasing to the 40mg, I feel much more tired on my days off with little energy. I'm hoping this eventually wears off.
Been on citalopram 10mg for three weeks now and if anything I actually  feel worse. Do not want to leave the house, just feel like sleeping, how long does it take?

I took citalopram 20mg @9pm and an hour later feeling weird & full blown side effects started! Sweating horribly. Hot/cold. had to shake my legs it felt like severe RLS! If I stopped shaking legs I felt full panic..15 hours legs went none stop! Awful panic & felt tired/wide awake/buzz at same time. No sleep. Burping, gas. Nauseated. Called dr in AM who said go to hospital get flushed and that it was possibly serotonin syndrome. I also take two 50mg tramadol a day. I have severe anxiety & tramadol help.  I was working on getting anxiety under control then off tramadol. I waited hrs to go to hospital as I wanted  it to wear off by itself, but at 3PM I went. They gave me fluids & xanax to calm me. I didn't want xanax, but they convinced me to take small dose. It helped relax me & calm my legs. The hospital doctor did not think serotonin syndrome from one dose celexa, instead thinks it  was some side effects of celexa & that sent my anxiety to the edge. Sent home with 6 xanax. Told to see my  own doc.  I took xanax to sleep last night. I did started to panic could feel the Xanax feeling but slept great. Feel better today.

I have been on Citalopram for almost 10 years. It has definitely helped to regulate mood, however, the side effects are quite real.First off, NEVER stop cold turkey. I felt great, and knew better, but decided I wasn’t going to take it anymore. I will never forget the feeling, like a heroin addict going through withdrawals. I’m always concerned about how citalopram is affecting my heart. Hard to describe, but definitely get the feeling sometimes of irregular heart beats. I’ve had countless EKGs and blood work, and always comes back negative - with docs saying it’s anxiety. A double edged sword ... good luck to everyone out there

Celexa (citalopram):I’ve suffered from stress and panic attacks all of my life. I’m in my 60’s now, and started Celexa around 18 years ago. It’s better than Zoloft or Prozac, which I found to have negative side effects. The problem with Celexa and other medications, is that the mental health community really doesn’t know how to fix actual problems, or what the patient is experiencing. They just throw mud on the wall, and hope it sticks. And general M.D.’s get their information from reading published articles.

I was suffering from anxiety and bouts of depression and ruminating. I started on citalopram 20mg and felt a little speedy for the first couple of days then boom the anxiety lifted. I felt great.After 3 months doctor upped dosage to 30 mg and for first couple of days felt a bit shivery that soon subsided. I am now living a happy and anxiety free life, no side effects and loving lifeThese really worked for me whereas sertraline prescribed previously zapped my energy and I felt groggy all the timeCitalopram are spot on

I was on citalopram for 13 years and coped though some pretty bad times and health scares, and I was able to cope.  Came off them two months ago and got vertigo which scared the life out of me.  I started having panic attacks, feelings of constant doom and that my life was over.  I felt odd in certain lights like I wasn't balanced in the room and it was horrific.  Lost two stone in 3 weeks!Moral of the story is now I'm back on citalopram I am starting to get better again and I never want to stop taking them again.. ever!.  I would likely have coped with the situation if I hadn't have come off these.  The feelings of dread are going and starting to feel like me again.  This drug does wonders.

I have been taking citalopram 20mg for just over 3 months now. I have GAD and like many others tried to battle through it for years only to end up an anxious mess all over again. Panicked getting buses, interacting socially and had terrible debilitating fight or flight. Bit the bullet and went to my doctors in tears feeling completely exhausted from it. I read these reviews the first week I took the 20mg and it helped with the highly increased anxiety and insomnia. Well now 3 months later I can get the bus without even thinking about it, I can laugh and interact without debilitating anxiety and haven’t had a panic attack in months. Night and day. My anxiety can still creep in but it’s a 2 at the most instead of a 10 with much better thought processes. Looking forward to when this feeling feels normal. Give it months not days or weeks to work as it’s still levelling out.
Celexa (citalopram):I have been on this for 3 months and it still Hasn’t worked at all for me and I’m on 20mg of it.

I was born with anxiety, never took a medication for it until 6 months ago. LIFE CHANGING! In the beginning my symptoms were: sweating buckets, only craved sugary foods, and short term memory loss. They were intense for the first 2 weeks but went away after 1 month. I would take those side effects over having anxiety any day! Before, I couldn’t leave my house and now I rarely run into a public situation that I can’t handle. I 100% recommend this medication. I know one medication won’t work for everyone but it’s worth a try!

Celexa (citalopram):I have been on citalopram for about  years now. While it worked wonders for my anxiety, I developed severe heart arrhythmia. After some research, I discovered that celexa is an SSRI that is linked to heart issues. I was on 20 mg per day, but dropped my dosage to 10 mg per day a few days ago. My heart palpitations are now gone, and I feel better physically. We will see how my psych health goes so far, a bit erratic and forgetful, but nothing I can't handle.

Celexa (citalopram):I want to give people a real review of this drug because the side affects are no joke. Note, that my dr started me on only 5mg to "mitigate side affects".  Also, I have been on zoloft before so am not a newbie to these types of meds. So, started Celexa one week ago and am just today starting to feel back to where I was when I started this drug.  Basically, I have had every side effect of this drug.  People are not lying.  It makes you feel 500% worse before it starts to work.  Started with severe panicky feelings and insomnia for about 3 days after day 2 on the meds.  Blood pressure would shoot up, sweats, skin crawling etc.  My dr prescribed me xanax just so I could sleep.  I had to take 3 days off of work it was so bad.  Then, it switched to massive headaches, and muscle aches which has been the last couple days.  Feels just like having the flu.  Cold all the time...then sweating.

Before taking any drugs I suffered with debilitating anxiety. I couldn't really do anything or go anywhere without panicking at its peak. I'd been trying to fix it naturally for many years before my doctor insisted on medication. First I tried sertraline but it was frankly horrible - rapid heart beat, fearful.Since starting Citalopram I've had none of that. Doctor started me on only 5mg as I was in a right mess and didn't trust her. I went up to 30mg over time but I found I was getting headaches on 30 so have settled on 20mg. I've been on 20mg for around 6 years and it really had changed my life for the better. I'm out and about, living life and have a good job. It makes me feel a bit muted and a bit "meh" and look grumpy most the time but I'm honestly happy and fine. Sexually everything is fine. I can still get panic attacks in extreme circumstances but it allows you to work through it. The effects of the attack are somewhat muted. All the affects of the attack are lessened.

Have been on citalapram for a few years  to ease terrible anxiety and OCD... I'm on 40mg per day now after being on 20mg and my life has hugely improved. There are still minor issues but we'll managed. I have no problems with citalapram but find I have tremors often though not noticeable by others and I seem to lose some emotional empathy... Sexual dysfunction is very slight.Overall a huge improvement and would recommend over fluoxitine.Here in the UK I pay $10 for 2 months supply.  Bravo NHS.

I have been on citalopram for stress and anxiety for 20 years.  It changed my life.  I see all these post about the side effects which do not last. I had the initial side effects too.  Call your doctor to discuss if you are uncomfortable with the side effects as there are medications to take with these types of drugs while you are adjusting.  One reason these are long term drugs and the doc will tell you that you can't go off and on these meds is every time you have to go through an adjustment period.  I have no long term side effects. If you are dealing with anxiety, depression, panic hang in there one of these meds will work for you

So, I took citalopram 20mg for 2 days for anxiety and stress. After that second day I was so horribly bed ridden with nausea, headaches, sleep deprivation, I couldn't even go to work because I genuinely felt like I was high and didnt even want to try getting behind the wheel, and my anxiety had tripled in strength and frequency, I was experiencing attacks I haven't felt since long before being able to handle it without medication. I would sleep for an hour maybe and wake up into a panic attack or just feeling that deep pit of anxiety in my stomach. After that second day I havent taken a pill and notified my doctor but even after stopping the medication (going on day 3 now) I still feel all of the negative side effects as well as the increased anxiety. There was no way I couldve stuck it out to the 4-6 week mark when the drugs full effect sets in. It is getting better but so slowly. I know it affects everyone differently but I would not recommend to anyone unless they start on a lower dosage than 20mg.

I was quite bad with anxiety and stress before taking the 10mg tablets. Now I have been on them for nearly 4 months my life has changed for the worse!I now have no motivation-horrendous memory loss-bad headache- feel like a total alien in friends company-constant bad thoughts-managing 4 hours sleep per night. The list goes on and on. I going to quit them as the other morning I forgot to take one and not sure if it was coincidence but I actually felt a bit better but after taking it late I felt awful again.

Used Citalopram couple of years ago and it worked wonders, cannot honestly remember side effects but was in a bad way emotionally so maybe didn't notice them. Just been put back on it, reaching end of week 2 and side effects week 1 were horrendous. Tired, anxious, insomnia, nausea,shakes - you name it I seemed to have it. Most of side effects now passed, still occasional dry/ funny taste in mouth and today feel terrible. Anxious in mornings but feel it's a bit more manageable. Still got insomnia waking every 2- 3 hours and increased urination so hoping this wears off soon as time goes on.

Feeling discouraged with my experience with citalopram, round 2. I have been prescribed citalopram in the past and it worked wonders for my anxiety; I was on it for 2 years and felt that I had a good handle so decided to ween off last year. Recently my anxiety started to take over my life and I went back to 20mg. I have been taking 20mg for over 3 months now and I kept telling myself it will get worse before it gets better. But my anxiety has sky rocketed since starting medication, and I have all of the negative side effects ( increased fatigue, diarrhea, disassociation, loss of appetite, increased anxiety, panic attacks, heart palpitations). I have decided that it is not worth going through these side effects as it has tremendously interfered with my quality of life. I have decided to ween off the medication and take a more holistic approach to my recovery. My heart goes out to everyone who is on this journey, it is tough but cherish the growth and it will guide you to healing!

I've been taking Citalopram for 5 years now, at 20mg for most of it. It's changed my life. I was numb and had debilitating anxiety before I took it (among other depression symptoms I've forgotten). The first two days I took it felt like something was happening. And I was more alert, had some insomnia. Day 3 I noticed that I was feeling less anxious. I'm no longer afraid of heights so long as I take the meds. It's not a miracle drug, my anxiety issues that resulted from trigger inducing events/emotions/memories are still around, but I can function and work past them. Things that were 3 or less are rarely an issue, 4-5 barely an issue, and 7 -8 usually stopped me from proceeding, now there's some anxiety, but I can work past them. (obvious, depends on how complex the trigger is.) And I can actually feel content now, my depression had stolen that from me. The best I could feel as a base line emotion pre-medication was Meh.

Celexa (citalopram):I have been on Celexa a week. It has been pure awfulness. Over the top anxiety and mania. Can not get out of bed. Can not function.I  read where you give this time but I am scared it will get worse.

I took 20 mg of celexa with wellbutrin for 9 years and it helped.  Last year I got off Celexa and didn't have withdrawals and got off Wellbutrin 2 months ago and had to go back to both this week due to anxiety being back .  I'm on day 2 of celexa and can't seem to be able to fall asleep.

On citalopram for a month now and I feel dreadful. I think this will be my last day taking them. I’ve turned in to jittering nervous wreck. Terrible sleeps waking up and not wanting to get up from bed. I also have TMJ which isn’t helped by the jaw clenching throughout the night.  Definitely not for me.

Citalopram has caused me to have extremely distressing problems which have effected my life and my relationships. I now suffer with twitching, tingling, muscle spasm, itching, unusual feelings within my body, head aches, burning feet.  All this gets worse at night and I now have to take gabapentin to ease the pain and discomfort.  I'm exhausted!It isn't going away - I stoped taking citalopram 2 months ago and this condition is still driving me mad.

Citalopram has saved my life. Before this drug I would panic over everything and overthink every event in my life. This med calms your brain and helps you live a normal life. I don’t care about the stigma these meds have, people that are saying bad thing probably don’t suffer like we do.

The 1st time I got on citalopram it was an answered prayer, life changing, zero side effects and never felt better. I took it at bedtime and slept incredible. Fast-forward some years, and  a change in states- I got off of citalopram. WELL...  I tried to go back on recently and it was awful. I only lasted 13 days on it. I had terrible side effects, and now panic attacks. I couldn't wait out the month because I literally was loosing my mind:(.I pray that if you try citalopram, that you will have the best experience like I did my 1st go  around. Many blessing to you..
Taken citalopram for 17 days, they made me worse than what I felt before, never again

Celexa (citalopram):This drug is awful.  I took three doses for anxiety and went into some kind of mania for a week.  Literally the most painful experience of my life.  It felt like someone was constantly stabbing my head.  I never experienced anything like it before.  It's been two months and I'm still nowhere near normal.  I have constant splitting headaches, and an inability to do my work.  Still have anxiety.  Be very very careful.  This drug can and will seriously mess you up.

Celexa (citalopram):It worked for my Mother, and my Aunt well but unfortunately this medication was not for me. While it did stop my panic attacks, that is only because it made me so numb, and feeling off, and detached the entire time I was on it I had to stop, I gave it plenty of time to work too, I was taking it for 9 months and no change. I could not live with the way it made me feel, I would rather have panic attacks then feel like the outside world didn't really exist! After coming off of it though 3 weeks later and all that detached, numb, fog has lifted so I can pretty confidently say it was the medication.
Taken at night, worse than ever. Wake up in the early hours feeling really anxious

I’ve been taking Citalopram for 4 days now the side effects are bearable due to prayer So far I’m ok and pray I continue to be ok, my nerves in my leg jump but the doctor said it’ll get better everyone body is different. I think this medicine actually works just be patient and keep praying we all will overcome this anxiety

Started this medicine citalopram for anxiety as I wasn’t eating or sleeping. Took the first tablet woke up at 1am too the most weird dream was shaking having hot flashes.  I thought I’d just keep trying it. Every night I was only getting 1-2 hours sleep waking up the same time every night and having too weird dreams. After 5 days of having no sleep and feeling worse than before I started it. I ended up in my local out of hours hospital with horrible thoughts shaking uncontrollably and not being able to concentrate. The doctors took me off this medication immediately and gave me sleeping tablets for 3 days while they came out my system. I was only on  10mg of citalopram. These tablets don’t suit everyone, as everyone is different but this was my experience and something I’d never wanna experience again

Have had anxiety my whole life..I’m 68...Mostly dealt with it by exercising 1 hour a day. I was prescribed lorazapam .05 mg on an as need basis and this works great when I need it. I take on average only 4 pills a month.  I just started celexa 10 mg about 2 weeks ago. Side effects are feeling a bit groggy, get tension headaches, had 2 slight panic attacks while driving.  Starting  to feel a little mellow. I’m hopeful I will see more change in the coming weeks. My main issue is social anxiety. I isolate myself frequently and have no interest in doing anything outside my daily routine. Hoping this helps as my wife deserves better.

This year my lifelong anxiety worsened, with panic attacks & a constant sickness & dread. I avoided the tablets for quite some time (relying upon propranolol & diazepam). After needing to take an extended spell off work, my dr asked me to try citalopram. I'm now on my 5th week and it's been WONDERFUL. The only side effects I had were in the first 3 weeks, I was getting really tired late afternoon. Online it'll tell you it can take 6 weeks to work, but I felt my anxiety ease after 3 days. Now on week 5 I'm feeling so much better, everything seems far more manageable & my resilience & ability to cope with stress is a lot better. I will probably never be cured fully, but this is honestly the best I've felt for years. All I would say if you're reading this & feeling as bad & hopeless as I was 5 weeks ago is: hang on, it does get better & the anxiety will lift eventually. I'll happily be on it forever if it means never feeling the way I did. Good luck everyone, this too shall pass x

I'm taking Citalipram 10 mg for  1 week now. I'm getting headache, nausea, and blurred visions and getting more anxious and on the 3rd day I had severe migraines and vomiting which I end up in bed the whole day. Phoned GP for advised and told me to sign off work for 2 weeks while I'm experiencing the side effects and to stay on 10 mg for 2 weeks instead of increasing it to 20 mg. GP asked me if I want to change the medication but I refused because I might start again with the side effects with another medication. I'm advised to ring immediately if this gets worse after 2 weeks for a medication review.

Been on a few pills, fluoxetine, sertraline, but Citalapram seen to be working for me @ 40mg daily. Only side effect is the excessive sweating, omg its embarrassing! Very tired at times too , but seriously thinking of halving my dose to see if it helps

Celexa (citalopram):I have been taking Celexa for 18 days for anxiety and stress. I had been battling along with out any medicine for so long before I threw in the towel after 7 months of social anxiety first that progressed to panic attacks, agoraphobia to depression. Whenever I interacted with people my face/neck/chest would become broken out in stress hives. I tried reading self help books on CBT and meditation first. Still was a wreck, so my doctor gave me a prescription for Celexa (20 mg), and I have to say it has almost turned my life back around and am feeling myself again. I took 10mg first four days then increased to 20mg on day 5. The first day of Celexa was kind of rough: I had a pounding headache, my body felt sore, diarrhea, irony taste in my mouth, and mild sweating.  Day 2 side effects are still there but less intense. After about a week I felt a decrease in anxiety and was much more controllable.

Yes citalopram does level your mood and stop the super highs and super lows but for me it also caused - weight gain, sleeping problems and erectile dysfunction. These actually made me so miserable that it ended up counter acting the good the meds were actually doing. I took them for five years and I went cold turkey a few weeks ago and now feel like a new man. I would definitely say either try something else or better still steer clear of meds entirely.

My doctor prescribed me citalopram after years and years of anxiety and paranoia. I’d tried various other medications but nothing that suited me. She warned me not to read the side effects so I didn’t - but I still felt terrible for 1 week. I had nausea, an upset stomach and slept so much, but it stopped as quickly as it started and now 8 weeks on I feel better than ever! All my anxiety has gone, I have no side effects apart from a little weight loss and a slight decreased libido. I take 20mg each morning. I found taking it with food eases the bad side effects at the start.

Started citalopram 5mg last week for anxiety and stres, I increased it to 10 mg a week ago. It’s been two weeks I'm on it. At first I was sleeping better. Than I started feeling weaknesses in my arms and now my legs. I feel like my muscles are really tensed and they are twitching a bit too. I have dry mouth but no nausea. I feel maybe a bit less depressed and anxious but the side effects are horrible. I feel like I’m going to be paralysed! If it wasn’t for the side effects I’d think it starts to work slowly. I’m seeing my psychiatrist tomorrow. Hope she’ll have a solution (I’ve tried so many meds.. getting desperate) anybody had weird muscle stuff and then it went away ???

Amazing. I had severe anxiety and developed depression due to coping with a chronic illness. I have been so low, upset and couldn't see how to pick myself up regardless of what I tried. I couldn't just keep coping day to day, I was a misery. I started on  citalopram 5mg then after 6 days went to 10mg and then finally to 20mg. It has been 4 months now. My message to you is: Hang in there!! The side effects are grim yes, yawning, headaches, increased anxiety and a bit of an upset stomach but they honestly pass and settle. I have no side effects now. Compared to how I felt, they were manageable and I didn't need time off work.The difference is night and day. It's like a lead weight has been lifted off my shoulders. It's cleared my daily migraines. I no longer have panic attacks, it hasn't effected my mental state or made me emotionless. I genuinely feel happier and calmer in myself, just my lows aren't as low. I have been getting out more, exercising, taking pride in things again. The difference is amazing.

First of all only read the positives and second of all - hang in there! I got hit with anxiety really bad. Started after a medical issue. It got so bad it was awful. I couldn’t leave the house and didn’t want to be alone. I was started on mirtazapine and it helped but I still couldn’t get rid of the morning into the day anxiety. I simply couldn’t increase the mirtazapine horrible side effects so I asked about adding citalopram. I’m super sensitive to meds so went really slow. Headaches, GI upset and increased anxiety. I wasn’t sure but then it settled down and I’m feeling better. Give it weeks not days. I would feel better for a couple weeks then not so good for a few. I feel it’s starting to even out. Just hit 6 weeks. Hoping things just keep getting better. So far it’s making me feel better every day like my old self. Never thought I’d take 1 med let alone 2 but I just want to enjoy life and get out there. Please try and stick with it it’s rough for weeks but you can do it!

Been on these meds for over a week and wanted to share the side effects. I do find I haven’t been having panic attacks this last week they usually happen every day. I take half a pill of 20mg (so I take 10mg) right before I go to bed so I’m not as tired but I do find it harder to wake up and sometimes if I wake up during the night I felt really dizzy and disassociated. I felt really sedated and just weird I had never felt like that before. Sometimes if I take it too late like 1am (before I sleep) I'll feel awful especially if I have to get up and go to work early. But later in the day I feel great. I’m too scared to take the pill earlier cause I don’t wanna have a panic attack over the side effects I’d rather just sleep through them.

This is my 2nd post - original was 2019-07-02. I have been on citalopram for couple of months now. I started citalopram for uncontrollable anxiety. Now my anxiety is manageable and I don't have to wake up with chest pain and tightness. However,  I start feel like I am depressed.  I believed I have only anxiety,  entire time when I was struggling with this anxiety.  Many Anxiety/depression sufferers commented citalopram worked for depression,  but not for anxiety.  The med  does not work for my depression in my case. B

Celexa (citalopram):Side effects are pure awfulness right from the jump. Blurred vision, floaters in vision, burning sensation of the skin, tightness of chest, migraines, nausea and vomiting, night terrors, suicidal thoughts, crying outbursts, panic state of mind, extreme anger, feeling out of control (almost out of body experience) and memory loss like anything. I couldn’t remember things I had said just minutes before hand. Not to mention zero libido and complete loss of any sort of emotion. It all makes for a real fun time. Mind you, I’ve never had any of this before starting this medication. So its a no-go in my book. Celexa made me feel the worst I’ve ever felt in my entire life. If you want real relief just stick to Xanax.

The first few days were quite rough. I had the runs on the first to third day, and each time I'd take it for the first five days or so, within an hour I'd begin to get what I like to call the 'zombies', basically a depressed state where I feel removed from myself and the world, and this can sometimes cause anxiety or panic if you don't know what it is. Thankfully I knew it was simply side effects. Another symptom was yawning. I suffered from lots of crazy dreams, kept waking up in the middle of the night, but within two weeks my anxiety had reduced, and by a month I was much better than when I started. Calm, less irritable, and no nausea or zombie feeling like I got with Prozac. Helped my relationship, shouldn't have come off, going back on.

Celexa (citalopram):I was severely bad, had councelling, psychology, I had severe panic attacks and severe paranoia after 2 weeks of taking these I noticed  good changes and now 2 months into them I feel pretty much  cured

It's great if you want to be a fat slob who never leaves the house.I had some things that happened in my life which really screwed me up and sent me into a tailspin. The doctor recommended I start an anti depressant and Celexa was suggested.Yes it worked for my depression (it did make me sort of dopey-happy) but there were a ton of side effects that ruined it:Yawning all the time.Headaches.Severe lack of libido.Sleep problems.Increased appetite.The worst part was the anxiety. Before I'd be anxious some of the time but going to work or the store or the bank was no problem. Now I have to work up the courage just to leave the house.Not only that but I have zero motivation to work out or do anything physical, to dress well and all of that and it increases my appetite. I'm tapering off it and will quit taking it within a couple weeks.

I went through a really long stage of my life trying to cope but a trigger set me off. I knew it was time to seek help. The 20mg worked fairly quickly and evened out my anxiety with better thought processes came more sleep at night. I still go through periods of insomnia/anxiety but working through it. But I've decided to reduced to 10mg as feel quite levelled at the moment. Then hopefully 3months I can start weaning of it. Fingers x no flare ups
Felt it working  quiet quickly but then levelled out so had dose increased.Only side effect really made me sleepy/tired.

Been on citalopram for 3 weeks now, started on 10mg and the first few days were horrendous, by about day 5/6 they started to calm to down a little bit, after 20 days I've had to go up to 20mg and experiencing the same feelings again of heightened anxiety and chest pain, hoping to settle again soon.I need something that stops me overthinking and thinking the worst all the time, but I will just see how these go for a few more weeks.
Celexa (citalopram):Say goodbye to an orgasm.

I’ve been on 10mg of Citalopram for a few years, no real side affects apart from a tickle of a cough now and again. My depression and anxiety got quite bad recently so my doctor increased me to 20mg which seemed to do great for a week then I guess the medication really started to kick in as I’ve been coughing constantly, dry tickle cough which gives me real bad headaches and also I have been sweating real bad (never one to normally sweat this bad) Can’t sleep although I’m tired and my appetite seems to have vanished which isn’t good for a type1 diabetic.  Will be going back to my GP Monday morning to change these as I cannot live with feeling like this, just feel dreadful.

I started this during a very hard time that I was going through with anxiety and panic during which I couldn’t eat or sleep. Obviously I needed to try something because I just couldn’t go on like that. Within a few days I could sleep and eat again and felt a lot better. I’ve been off and on the drug on a few different occasions in my life since then when I was having a hard time and it worked for me mostly. I think due to starting and stopping the drug too often recently during a period of indecisiveness I may have developed a reaction to it because it doesn’t work for me anymore, but I am really thankful for the times it helped me. Side effects I experienced were nausea and increased anxiety.

Now it is 2 years since I first was prescribed Celexa. After some minor side effects for a couple of weeks my anxiety and depression was gone. It still is and I don’t want to stop taking it for fear of my condition resurfacing back. I have only been on 20mg

Was ok while I was on citalopram except for the headaches, grogginess, feeling of pressure in my eyes. But then I started getting personality changes and could never really concentrate on my college work. They never actually helped my depression or anxiety (in fact I think my anxiety was worse) but I really didn't know any better and was distracted with college to realise at the time. As soon as I came off them though (in 3 months which was recommended) everything went to hell. I now have progressive neuropathy, tinnitus, IBS, PGAD, bladder problems. Not to mention how much WORSE I feel mentally and emotionally than I did originally. I'm now in such a dark place and go in to catatonic states mostly because of how bad the pain gets. Withdrawing can be so dangerous and surprisingly it is extremely common to cause permanent damage! I recommend looking into very slow tappering on websites like survivingantidepressants, if you want to withdraw.

My anxiety elevated from mild to severe recently. Doctor gave me 20mg of citalopram. I had very bad panic attack about 30 minutes later and end up in emergency room.  I was told by the doc. that it takes time to medication to kick in. So I just kept taking 20mg next 4  days.  Well, I  experienced 2 more panic attacks and severe anxiety. I could not stay still, jittery and nervous all day long. It was horrible. So I decided to cut the med in half (I didn't even ask dr.)and it was instant relief!  Now this is my 4th week of citalopram and I feel better. I still feel anxious, but no  more chest pain or chest tightness. I learned amount of med makes huge difference. I am looking forward further improvement!
Very tired at the start,dry mouth,sweating alot, started to feel less anxious after 2 week

Worked very well for 15 years for me no anxiety 20mg. Takes about 4 weeks to start feeling really better and sometimes longer , I have just had a health scare and my anxiety came back big time which was worrying in its self but I have been upped to 30mg and after 2 weeks starting to lose the anxiety slowly.

I have been taking it for three weeks now. Started 10mg and went to 20mg but that gave me insomnia. Wake up every morning at 2am and can't sleep. Now back to 10.Feel like I have more energy but it has done very little for my anxiety. Still get those same cold feelings/panic attacks.Doc says I'm healthy and my testosterone is normal but it doesn't feel normal as my libido was low even before the drug and I have a very hard time gaining muscle/losing fat.My plan is to use it for two months but if things don't improve I will find a doctor who specializes in men's issues.
I started celexa generic 7 days ago and I feel foggy headed, sleepy, but have more energy. This mean it's working?

Celexa (citalopram):The worst drug that I've  ever taken IN MY LIFE.  I suffer from chronic anxiety and my doctor decided to prescribe celexa since the other brands made me feel horrible. Prior to taking the dose, I researched the every detail out of it and read nothing but good reviews thus, I decided to take it.  I took one dose that one evening. The next morning, while letting my dog out the yard, I felt the room turning black and a horrible sensation of nausea came over me.  I rushed to the bathroom confident that I was going to vomit and before getting there, I fainted; eyesight went, hearing went, my body was like a noodle..couldn't move. When I came to, I had the horrible nausea, sweats, and I felt my heart rate was through the roof.  I went to the ER but all they did was give me allergy meds which didn't help. Symptoms did not subside at all.  This nightmare lasted TWO HORRENDOUS WEEKS
Celexa (citalopram):While on Celexa, my stress and anxiety only became amplified. The worst few months of my life were spent taking celexa and it only made everything worse.

Wish I had found this years ago, it has totally changed my life.  I started with 10 mg and currently take 30 mg.I was an utter mess before I took Citalopram and now I can cope.It won`t solve every problem and you are still going to need help but Citalopram will make make a massive difference to your day and life.

Brilliant for me. Has been 20 years at least. Started with a quarter for about 5 days, then a half for years. When I developed depression and anxiety after having babies I went back on starting at a half for a week then full 20g for the past 14 yrs and it’s been just fine. I still have emotions but I’m not as up and as down. Best for controlling temper.

Had anxiety all my life didn’t think this medication would work to be honest and got to four weeks and was going to give up but then I woke up and I felt calm went to work felt calm started thinking about my future and how glad I was that I was alive. I had anxiety in shops, meetings etc and this has practically took about %80 -90 percent of that away. If you struggle with anxiety like me and I was very bad then try this medication I feel like the person I always wanted to be. Been told after 6-8months it may wear off a bit but dose can be upped from 20mg to 40mg. Why didn’t I ask for help years ago is my biggest regret. First few weeks you won’t feel great but your body gets use to it and it kicks in. Also don’t let your anxiety stop you from taking it lol coz it stopped me for a while but thank goodness I took it. Good luck

I struggle with anxiety and have done for many years, I was put on citalopram 10mg but  just stared at the box for 3 months worrying about the side effects. I upped the courage one day and cut the tablet in half (doctor said I could) I instantly felt different after about 30/40 minutes. I felt calm. I’m on day 4 and the side effects I’ve experienced are feeling sick (only for the first day) headaches, sweating a lot, feeling dizzy (calming down a little bit) and not being able to sleep at night. I don’t feel as anxious, panic attacks have calmed down, I’m able to get out of the house again. These tablets do take time to kick in and I’m still waiting for the full effect to kick in, the side effects can be very hard to deal with but pull through. These tablets are safe and are to help but do not work straight away❤️

Started citalopram teva 2 weeks ago for depression and anxiety. Had very little side effects. Had been feeling so anxious and sad with terrible palpitations for about a month beforehand. Minor side effects 4 first week. Lost appetite. Tiredness and yawning and not having much sleep. After 10 days I could feel such a difference. Mood lifted, appetite much improved palpitations stopped. Now 2 weeks later I feel so good I'm even sleeping much better. Doctor said I should continue it for six months and I def will

Celexa (citalopram):I’ve been on 10 mg of Celexa for about 6 months now. I remember automatically feeling happier after a few days being on it, (placebo effect MAYBE :)) I started to notice I also wouldn’t dwell on things that upset me, I went through a horrid breakup, I remember not thinking as much about my ex and being able to feel more positive and not ruminate on negative thoughts that would typically trigger my anxiety and moodiness. Everyone has different experiences on SSRIs so it’s hard to find the right one. Only issues with this medication was the complete loss of libido and occasional digestive issues, I also suffer from IBS - so If you have a sensitive stomach, this may give you occasional digestive issues? And lots of yawning lol! Other than that, this SSRI was the best I have ever been on, (Zoloft makes me sick and tired..)

I have been taking this drug for the last 3 weeks and let me tell you it’s been awful, ever since the first dose I have felt like I’m not myself anymore I have aches and pains everywhere and within 1 hour of taking it I get really bad sweats and pale skin which do eventually subside. The drug in my opinion has to many cons to be useful to everyone just take a look at the medication leaflet in box it’s unraveling a scroll from the medieval times. I firmly believe the cure for my anxiety will be my own mind defeating it. I will however carry on taking the tablets until my mediation review in 4 weeks but I highly doubt the restless leg syndrome I have now got will subside within this time. There has to be and will be a more safer drug developed

I went from being agoraphobic in 2010 worked myself through that with no medication for two plus years. The anxiety never did leave though. I was unable to do the things I loved anymore without having panic attacks. I started Celexa just under two months ago and I have to say the result most definitely outweighs the few side effects I had in the beginning. I feel like myself again I can now do the things I love to do with no anxiety at all. It feels nice to just be myself again. I would definitely recommend sticking with it for 2 months minimum. It started to work for me within a couple of weeks. Just progressively getting better as the weeks went on.

I was originally prescribed Escitalopram and I had a horrible reaction to it, I was hallucinating, burning up, couldn’t sleep, diarrhea, extreme nausea. I was switched to Citalopram 10mg, after what had happened with the Escitalopram I was terrified of even trying another medication. I finally got the courage to take it. My first dose was yesterday and I took it with food to help reduce any possible nausea. It made me drowsy the first few hours and I took a nap. When I woke up I was a little light headed but not bad, I was a little dizzy through out the day. By the afternoon I want to say I was feeling something good from it, as I was more positive and I looked around at my little family and felt at peace a little. It did cause a little insomnia. May try to avoid napping. I took my second dose today with food also and just some slight nausea, more like a heart burn feeling. And clammy hands/feet. It does make you sweat a little more than normal. But so far so good!

Celexa (citalopram):I took this Celexa for about 15 years ago for depression and stayed on it for about 3 years.  At first it made me a little sleepy but that went away after a couple weeks.  The only side effect was it made it very difficult to ejaculate.  I stopped taking it because I started to feel too chilled out/apathetic.  I cut my dosage down to half for about a week and quit. No side effects at all.  Now  I'm 49 and started taking it again for stress/anxiety.  First two days started with 5mg then upped it to 10mg.   By about the 6th day I was feeling mild nausea and some dizziness.  The 7/8th day was terrible-hot flashes, anxiety, nausea-had to take xanax and zofrin.Then by the 10th day, I felt a change-almost like a light switched.  I'm thinking ok, this is working now!   I still feel a little nausea  but my mood has improved.   I'm also feeling the difficulty with ejaculation.  I'm not sure if the side effects are due to my age now or what but I was surprised since I didn't have them in the past.

I have severe ADHD and learned to cope with it as a kid.  I am under a lot pressure.  My doctor gave me Celexa 20 mg and it messed up.  I took the pills and felt like rubbish, couldn't sleep and was agitated.  I honestly was ready to kill people over little things.  I would never recommend anyone take this stuff.

I had taken Lexapro a year ago with great results, weaned off and was doing well for a while.  Had some really stressful life events and tried to go back on Lexapro,  just one dose and I had the most horrendous panic attack I've ever had in my life that lasted for hours.  Ended up in a psych ward and was put on celexa. Then five days in and another horrendous panic attack that left my body moving without me ... I mean my eyes were rolling around in my head as I could not stop moving, rocking, walking and had horrible thoughts, crying binges and man I thought my life was over. I was hospitalized again and put on IV fluids and ativan which really helped.   I guess SSRI's just aren't for me anymore. This skinny woman lost 15 lbs total over this nonsense.   Never ever again ... I am opting for CBT therapy now

I was given buspirone and citalopram. Unfortunately I didn't understand how the doctor told me to take the meds and I was only taking buspirone.  For two weeks it worked great then I  started to have problems  I was unable to drive without having severed panic attacks.  I had one so bad that I was stuck un strange neighborhood for 3 hours due to a panic attack.  I went to the pharmacist to see how I was supposed to take the med and she explained to me that I was supposed to take citalopram every day and the buspirone as needed up to three times a day but she stated I shouldn't need the buspirone after a while once the citalopram started to do the job.  she was correct.  I started this drug a few weeks ago and it has been a lifesaver.  I feel like I am living again.  I still have a little nervousness but not panic.  I'm able to drive without stopping or wanting to jump out of my car.  I don't think so much which I believe was a huge issue for me. I felt dangerous on the road before taking this drug.

My stress and anxiety were making it hard for me to cope with daily life. I'm an RN student, work part time and am a single mom. I've struggled with anxiety for over a decade, and see a counsellor regularly. I decided to try citalopram because it's an SSRI and listed on many sites as an antidepressant with one of the fewest side effects. My primary doctor agreed that it would be a good idea. The first week of taking it I did have some adverse side effects of slight diarrhea and upset stomach, slight light-headedness. Very manageable symptoms, I knew were to expected upon starting. After a week and a half I noticed that I was sleeping through the night without waking up. After two weeks I noticed in the morning I would wake up and feel ready to get out of bed right away and start the day. After 3 weeks I notice that my attitude is much more relaxed. When I get stressed, I'm able to deal with the situation with less explosiveness and am calmer with everything.

My anxiety was making day to day life very difficult and severely interfering with my work. I began to experience symptoms of panic in meetings and during phone calls. On March 7th I started taking 10mg citalopram every morning and two weeks later increased to 20mg. I was very tired starting the drug and when I increased the dose but this went away after a few days and I have not noticed any other side effects. My sex drive has not been affected and I sleep well. It was around the 5 weeks mark that I noticed that I felt increasingly calm, able to think clearly and look at things objectively. The panicky thoughts and physical feelings of dread are practically nonexistent. I do not think I would have been able to come so far so quickly without citalopram. I feel happier than I have in years, and while I think the combination of CBT and citalopram has been the golden formula for me, citalopram itself has made a huge difference to my life.

So far I’ve only taken one 20mg tablet. The side effects are absolutely horrible. Within two hours of taking the medication last night, I had horrible nausea, heart burn like my whole chest was on fire, and violent, uncontrollable tremors. Legs especially were shaking so bad it was as if I was having a seizure, my upper body shaking as well, but not as much. I ended up taking Gravol, (anti nausea medication) and Melatonin in order to fall asleep. I slept fine, woke up 9 hours later alright besides sore muscles, like I’d fallen off a horse or ran a mile. Within an hour after waking up, I became extremely nauseous yet again, but worse. My tremors came back just as violent, and my heart burn returned as well, but worse. I took Gravol again, but haven’t been able to fall asleep due to the pain. I began shivering and yawning profusely, my face feeling hot, and my shoulders feeling freezing cold, feels like I have a fever or flu. 100% going to try get off this drug as soon as possible.

This medication citalopram  did not seem to help my anxiety at all, but instead trigger it. I was fine for the first few weeks, still adjusting and just going through the normal side effects that come along with almost any SSRI. After about a month I started to notice I was losing more of the little appetite I had. I usually would only have about one panic attack a week on Prozac, but with Citalopram I have at least five.

I was prescribed Citalopram after my dad unexpectedly passed away.  Within 48 hours of taking it, I started having significant side effects like loss of appetite, increased anxiety and for worst part a complete lack of sex drive and the inability to climax.  I have always had a very healthy sex drive and am involved in a committed relationship. I was encouraged by my doctor to continue taking it for 30 days since these side effects were "normal" for the drug.  After 30 days nothing had changed and I started really wishing I had my sex drive back - so did my girlfriend!  At that point I stopped taking it. After 2 months of being off of the drug, my sex drive still has not returned which has honestly wrecked my life.  I'm now learning that for some people this drug can wreck your sex drive for life. I can't even express how frustrating this is.  Unless you are prepared to not have sex for the rest of your life, I would strong caution everyone to run away from this drug.

I have bad anxiety, and depression , from previous relationship. Started citalopram , 7 years ago, still taking it, best drug , I cannot go a day without it. I worked in a high stress er. So my dr advised me not to stop taking it. My side effects are sweating and nausea. But I can deal with those. Love it!

Celexa (citalopram):I was prescribed Celexa to help me cope with the anxiety and stress caused  by severe symptoms of  PTLDS (Post-Treatment Lyme's Disease Syndrome.) The medication has greatly helped me cope with the symptoms.  I  still have these  PTLDS symptoms... but with the Celexa, I suffer none  of the anxiety the symptoms cause!   I started on a 20 mg dose but quickly found that 10 mg provided the same benefit.  I have long been prescribed Metoprolol  to quell panic attacks and heart palpitations (with the added benefit of lowering my blood pressure!)  and I think the Celexa has been of great benefit to continuing my feelings of well-being.

I have been in Citalopran for 2 months  for my anxiety and stress and  can feel the full effects of this medication, the good and the bad. The good part is my anxiety is well under control, I used to stress over the smallest things and now I am able to calmly and objectively analyze every situation rationally. I also feel much calmer and relaxed, but not lethargic; it's a good feeling. I am also able to focus much better and do not overreact or explode in anger as I did much to often before. Now the bad news (depends how you see this), the delayed ejaculation is a major problem for my spouse; it takes forever to orgasm. I know this is usually a good thing but not when you can go for over an hour with no finish line in site, it is frustrating and many times I just give up. If I have to weigh the pros & cons of this medication I will probably stay on it because it affects my career and family in a positive way.

Taken my first 20mg pill tonight after 3 months of looking at the pack. I have suffered with anxiety most of my life. Over the past year it has become unbearable so tonight I finally pluck up the courage to take one. All was well and I was so proud I actually took it. 2hours later I had severe diarrhoea and shaking uncontrollably also had a dry mouth. Are these side affects normal? I’m freaking out and worried about taking tomorrow tablet now. Any advice would be grateful. I just want my life to be ‘normal ‘. X

Celexa (citalopram):I was on Zoloft for about a week then they switched me to celexa. I took celexa for 4 days and they say give it time the medicine will work. The first day I took it I was extremely tired but when it came time to go to bed I could not fall asleep and if I did it was only for an hour or two before waking up in a panic state. The medicine kept me in bed for days and caused everything to hurt. I felt like I was out of my body and was confused which was not normal for me. My heart felt like it was pounding out of my chest. It also gave me weird vivid dreams. I thought taking antidepressants would help me but I feel like they just caused more pain and suffering.

I had citalopram prescribed to me over a year ago  for anxiety and stress and have left them in the packet since as I was so scared about the side effects etc. After getting to a really low point and reading some more reviews I decided to take the plunge and start them. I started on 10mg every morning for 4 days ( half the pill ) I then went up to 20mg. I have been on these for 2 weeks now and I have had no major side affects. For the first week I couldn't really eat as I had no appetite but that is slowly coming back. I no longer wake up dreading the day, I wake up feeling positive and my moods have definitely improved. I feel more sociable and able to talk to people better than I would have done before. I am so so grateful that I have finally taken the pills, they have improved my life the last 2 weeks during such a hard time and I am hoping things only get better!

First time reviewer and if you are wondering "does citalopram work?" - it has worked wonders for me.  I had anxiety/stress mainly due to work and  family commitments. I was undiagnosed for years.   I finally saw my Doctor. I was hesitant at first to be on medication, the stigma of mental health.  I finally took it out of desperation and there  was gradual but significant change.  It has saved my job and significant relationships.  I am currently on 40mg.  My side effects are  putting on weight (30lbs) thru bad eating/alcohol and socializing (being more sociable due to meds) but currently lost 16lbs in the last 8 weeks mainly through intermittently fasting/boot camp and weight loss/gym challenges.  I will update on my weight loss in another 4 weeks, otherwise I highly recommend Citalopram!!!

When I first started to take 20mg of citalopram, my whole life was falling apart. I couldn't go out,  I had split up from a long term, mentally abusive relationship. Before long I realised I couldn't leave the house without this horrible and overwhelming fear. A work trainer told me about anxiety and this medication. From that moment on, my life got better.  I am not fixed by any means but then I am 90% better now. The side effects are crap, headaches, weird brain zapping sensations, crazy dreams, hallucinating, yawning, slurring words for about 4 to 6 weeks. Stick with this pill it genuinely will work took about 2 or 3 months for me to feel better. You will see a difference.

Celexa (citalopram):Had a pretty bad panic attack and the MD suggested I take Zoloft. Stayed on that 5 days at 25mg and felt insane, out of body like and had awful thoughts, which I never had in my life. Then the doctor started me on 10 mg of celexa and it made me go manic. Doctor suggested I drop the dose to 5 mg, stayed on that for three weeks, had suicidal thoughts, manic episodes, restlessness and the constant feeling of wanting to move and really bad insomnia. Doctor said I had akinesia. I'm off all medications now, this is going into my second week and I feel much better. My suggestion, if you have panic attacks ask for benezos first, also ask your MD if possible for a gene test. Then ask them to rule out bipolar or bipolar spectrum disorders. Some people cannot handle SSRIs.

I have taken this tablet for 3 months. It has changed my life. I have suffered a lot of trauma over the past 3 years and I was at my wits end.  I had panic attacks, sleeplessness and depression. I felt completely overwhelmed with life and was filled with fear and dread continually. I eventually gave in to medication.  I experienced relief from my symptoms after 1 week and my blood pressure went down. I was calmer and my family and friends noticed the change in me very quickly. I had been on other anti depressants before but never had the effect that Citalopram gave me. I am trying to reduce to 10mg to see how I cope. I never want to go back to the way I felt before so I am prepared to go back up to 20mg if necessary. I sleep well and I waken feeling very calm and relaxed. My OCD is not as bad and I can now leave things unfinished without feeling anxiety.

I was prescibed citalopram because my anxiety was taking over my life. Really pleased with the results. First few days I had a nasty headache and slept for a few hours after I took it, but by the 5th day they were gone. I have started to do things I was severely scared of, and am already building confidence. I have always felt my moods were really erratic, but I feel so much more stable. Even on a low dose of 10mg it has changed me completely. I do have cognitive behavioural therapy as well. I don't feel as it's cured my anxiety but lowered it to a point where I can start managing it. Really wish I'd tried it sooner as I was too frightened to touch medication.

I never write reviews. I had to for this..I was in a severely abusive relationship for 3 years & when I finally got out of it I had the most horrible anxiety/panic disorder. I couldn’t even leave my house without being terrified. I have PTSD as well from that event. I have to say, ever since taking citalopram (20mg once a day) I haven’t felt anxiety since (except situations where anxiety is normal) I don’t panic anymore.
